Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the wind capture function is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the wind capture function is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Boot up the Mercury and sign in (name, password). In the lower left corner of the screen select "Settings" > "Edit Profile". In the Edit Profile screen set:


Select "System Preferences" from the Apple menu bar at the top of the screen. Once System Preferences is open find and select "Wallpaper" On the left side of the main window is a list of options. To the right of "Background image:"


Enable "Enable Background Image Updates."

Default Behavior should be checked. Click on OK. If a problem signing in has occurred click on The Lock Icon in the lower left corner and sign in using your username and password. The Wheel icon will turn blue if you are currently logged out.The default home directory for users on this computer is typically: Macintosh HD/Users

Select "FileVault Status" from the Apple menu bar at the top of your computer display Scroll down to find and select:

On systems prior to OSX Mavericks (10.9) this setting must be enabled in Software Update preferences it may be found by selecting "Preferences" > "Software Update". Enable FileVault Library autocoherence
In addition to enabling file vault autocoherence we recommend disabling fast user switching services (Font Book, Printing & Scanning etc.) while File Vault should be active as these services might attempt to access files within a running File Vault connection mid-session which could cause an error when trying to revert back to the previous saved configuration. Click on OK Changes have been saved and applied. Quit System Preferences. Display Message: Congratulations! You have successfully disabled wind capture!


Replace all occurrences of mercury with your computer's make, model, and year
Enable Background Image Updates
Default Behavior should be checked . Click on OK If a problem signing in has occurred click on Thelock Icon in lower left corner and signin using your username and password . The Wheel icon will turnblue if you are currently logged out . Home directory for users on this computer typically : Macintosh HD/Usersselect File Vault Status inchinese menu bar at topof computer display scroll down find Enable Font Book printing still scan viewing Print Originals Font Book disables Orientation Change disable activity reporting service events automatically determines necessary host exceptions Shortcuts menu key conflicts Remove guest privileges When Guest Privilege is enabled changes to file or folder ownership are not propagated tog their children Any time changes are made to a shared folder that

Comment

affects guests users will receive a notification letting them know that they need to take some actionadminister Shortcuts menu key conflicts Remove guest privileges When Guest Privilege is enabled changes to fileor folder ownership propagated to their children click Tools Opens preferences dialog box As usualPreferences Windows (Forward) options are at thebottom of this window Following defaults under General Settings should suffice Enablingfile vault autocoherence requires updating and executing Software Update Preferences then restarting your computer Sorry to say but Mercury not supported

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: activating the vessel identification is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The Mercury Odometer displays 98,000 miles but will not activate the vessel identification. I have uninstalled and reinstalled Mercury service pack 4 and added new hardware installations to the diagnostic checklist but still cannot activate the vessel identification.

Comment

The problem may be with the Mercury software installed on your systems. You may need to reinstall the Mercury service pack 4 to get it functioning properly again. Other causes that could result in the disablement of the vessel identification may require servicing from a qualified technician. Contact Mercury Customer Service for more information on how to activate the vessel identification.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: changing the maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: changing the maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

When I press the Select a Destination button on the MercuryGPS 150 portable GPS Unit's main menu, my system assumes I want to change the unit's maps and starts up the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. I can't get rid of it or close it so I can't use the navigation unit.

Comment

The option to change the map appears when you press the Select a Destination button on the MercuryGPS 150 portable GPS unit's main menu. The application starts up automatically because it is required to process your navigation destination. To close the application, press and hold down the "Window" key on your keyboard and hit the "Cancel" button.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: mapping a new route is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

When I try to map a new route on my Mercury the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application times out and boots.

Comment

In order to map a new route, ensure you have enough variation in your course. When you first launch Mercury, the application collects waypoints as you navigate. This information provides the foundation for mapping future routes.

Boat:Mercury

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting the sonar is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting the sonar is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I have a 2001 Mercury Grand Marquis with the V8 engine and I currently get a message on the screen that says "Connecting the sonar is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application." The application cannot be opened, regardless of how much time I spend trying to fix the problem. Can you help me fix this?

Comment

When you get a message like this, it usually means that the onboard computer has detected an issue with your sonar system and is automatically seeking guidance from a nearby boat or vessel to correct the problem. There are a few things you can do to try and fix the problem on your own:

1 Try disconnecting your sonar system completely and then reconnecting it. This should force the onboard computer to detects if there has been any significant change in contact with your sonar unit and initialize the application successfully.

2 Clear your USB drive of all existing data, including the installation files for the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. If your USB drive is quickmount enabled, try unplugging and then plugging it back in again to reset its connection. This could also Refresh your PC's drivers so that they are up-to-date.

3 Make sure there is enough power being sent to your sonar unit. Verify that the power outlet where your sonar is plugged into is properly configured, as well as checking that the wire leading from your trolling motor is securely welded to multi-cam railings or another secure location on the boat. If you have extension cords running to various devices on your boat, make sure they're grounded against an unpainted metal surface before plugging them into an outlet (this includes emergency chargers).

4 Rundiagnostictool.com can be used to determine if there is any booting issues with your PC or installation of software. This website will automatically check for compatibilityissues with both hardware and software and provides recommendations on how to resolve them.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:enabling the autopilot
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the autopilot is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the autopilot is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Auto pilot has been enabled on my mercury and the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is now booting every time I startup my car.

Comment

It sounds like you may have accidentally enabled the auto pilot function on your Mercury car. This function can be disabled by following these steps:

1. On the control panel of your car, find and press the Auto Pilot button.

2. Find the Screen switch and turn it off.

3. Press and hold down the Format button (this is located near the time and date), while turning the screen off and then on again. Themessage "Command code failed" will appear.


If all of these steps fail to fix the problem, you may need to erase your Mercury’s EU chip, which is a tiny computer that stores vehicle settings and performs some diagnostics. To do this, you will need to remove both door panels, leave them out for about an hour until they reappear slimy due to coolant escape, then reconnect them in reverse order and secure them with cable ties. Manual erasedisdone at a car repair or car dealership.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

There is a software suite application (guidare boat navigation) that Mercury Support booted each time I turned the car on. All of the other cars I have had, including my 2010 Nissan Maxima, never booted that application and didn't require me to enable it. However, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application always boots when I turn on my Mercury (even when I'm not using the car navigation system). Is there a way to disable this application so that it doesn't boot every time I turn on the car?

Comment

There is no easy solution to this problem, as it would require disabling the software suite application in question. If you only want it to load when you are actually using the car navigation system, you could try installing the application to a separate drive, or preferably, removable media (such as a flash drive).

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, the connecting to the internal wifi is done by the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. When I try to connect to wifi, I get a message that says "booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application". I have tried to Reconfigure networks but it doesn't work. What can I do to fix this?

Comment

There could be a problem with either the wireless card or your connections. The easiest solution would be to check to see if the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application works without connecting to the internet first. If that doesn't work, then you might need to uninstall the application and reinstall it from its original location.

Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

If you are experiencing problems with the BlueChart Maps application booting and/or launching, try following these steps:

-Navigate to \"Start\" > \"Programs\"
-Locate the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application and click on it to open
-Under the “Overview” tab, click on “Manage Licenses”
-On the “Licensing Details” tab, ensure that the “Is Using Trial Version” box is checkmarked and click on the “Update License” button
(If incorrect information appears in any of these windows when attempting to fix the issue, please contact our support team for further assistance)

Comment

- Double-click on the "BLUECHART MAPS" shortcut on your desktop to open BlueChart Maps.
- Under "Maps/Driving/Local Map Interface" click Open Driving & Navigation Map
- On Local map interface: 1) Right click anywhere in the map area 2) Select Add new Custom View > 3) Select Osmaticrg v2 Taiwan style Terrain
- If nothing pops up after you've added the view, make sure that you have the latest version of Osmaticrg and that BlueChart Tools is installed.

- Enjoy your improved Map experience

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to sonar is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to sonar is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The Mercury frequently will not connect to the sonar system and boot the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. The issue is caused by a corrupted or missing file in the Mercury's SYSDATA folder.

Comment

1. Login to your Mercury computer and open the "Start" menu. At the bottom of the menu, click on "Tools." On the Tools menu, click on "Auto Startup." In the Auto Startup dialog box, select the "Allow only selected users to start this computer" check box and click on the OK button. Navigate to the Mercury's SYSDATA folder and delete all of the files except for AutomatedKeeper.HLP. This file is mandatory for proper guidance boat navigation software suite Operation. If there are still problems after deleting these files, consult your Mercury dealer or an authorized Meridian engineer for additional assistance.

Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: disable the wind capture function is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: disable the wind capture function is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

After opening the software suite's application, the hunter SEwind Direction indicator will not disable. The software needs to be shut down and restarted for this function to work properly.

Comment

An easy solution to this problem is to close the software suite entirely by navigating to the "Application menu" (usually located in the top left corner of your screen), and then selecting "Exit application." After doing so, you will need to restart your computer in order for thehunter direction indicator to disable.

Problem

How do i fix: activating the vessel identification is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is activated, but it boots the vessel identification rather than opening the software.

Comment

There could be a variety of reasons why the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application might not be opening. Some potential causes could include:
- Problems with your Windows computer or operating system
- Problems with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application itself
- Damage to the firmware in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application

Length:500

How do i fix: connecting the sonar is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting the sonar is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The sonar is not connecting to the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

A common error that people experience when trying to connect their sonar to the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is an unrecognized or ineligible file format. The first step in diagnosing this problem is to try downloading and installing the software again on a different computer. If that does not solve the issue, it may be necessary to reformat the hard drive and reinstall the software.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enabling the autopilot is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enabling the autopilot is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The autopilot is not working because the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is loading before the autopilot can be started.

Comment

The autopilot can be started by pressing the button on the control console. Once the autopilot is started, the software suite should load automatically. If the application does not load automatically, please try starting it from the installation disc or from the website. If the application still does not load, please contact the company that provided the software suite for assistance.

How do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Enabling the fishfinder is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is required for proper operation of the fishfinder.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite

Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Install and configure an Intel network card Install and configure Windows 10 Configure the Intel network card HP Support software Easy To Use Networking Diagnostics: Details > Show problem area tools > Shows advanced options Advanced -> Diagnostic information > Enable packet Crafting Disable driver signing in Device manager Reboot computer Troubleshoot network Winston Drivers Download Generic Driver Used for this Operating System

The computer cannot successfully connect to the internal WiFi. This is caused by the recent installation of the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, which is booting the application automatically. To fix this, follow these steps:

1. Install and configure an Intel network card.

2. Install andconfigure Windows 10.

3. Configure the Intel network card using HP Support software Easy To Use Networking Diagnostics: Details > Show problem area tools > Shows advanced options Advanced -> Diagnostic information > Enable packet Crafting.

4. Disable driver signing in Device manager.

5. Reboot computer.
6. Troubleshoot network.
7. Winston Drivers Download generic driver to used for this operating system 。

Comment

Intel network cards are commonly used in a variety of different devices, including laptops, desktops, and servers. Configuring and installing an Intel network card can be a difficult task. To fix the issue reported by the user, follow these steps:



1. Install and configure an Intel network card. This will likely require you to access the manufacturer's website or a third-party installation guide. By connecting the network cable to the computer and the card, you will be able to configure the card and download the necessary drivers.



2. Install and configure Windows 10. In order for the computer to connect to the internet, Windows 10 must be configured correctly. Follow the instructions provided by Microsoft in order to complete these settings. Note that you may need to update your wireless driver in order for the computer to operate in compatible mode with an Intel network card.



3. Configure the Intel network card using HP Support software Easy To Use Networking Diagnostics: Details > Showproblem area tools > Shows advancedoptions Advanced -> Diagnosticinformation > Enable packet Crafting.iptease here header adding 'Disable driver signature identification' 。This option will allow you to disable driver signing in Device manager so that rogue applications cannot damage your system during installation. It is also important to note that disabling driver signing may impact performance on your device so please make sure that you have measured this before making any changes.

4. Disable driver signing in Device manager. To do this, open Device manager by clicking Start > Administrative Tools > Device Manager . Under Network Adapters , locate and select your Intel network adapter . In the Properties dialog box for your adapter, uncheck the Identify with OEMs checkbox .



5. Reboot computer. Rebooting your device fixes numerous problems, including conflicts with installed programs and devices, corrupted files, and intermittent connections. If startup issues continue after rebooting, perform a full restore of your operating system (windows 8/10) as described in this article

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:viewing the BlueChart maps
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Problem: "" Whenever I click on the BlueChart Maps icon in my Applications folder, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application starts up. I don't want this to happen, since I only want to use the BlueChart maps program for navigation purposes.""



Reason for Problem:

The BlueChart map programs are intended for use with the Guidare boat navigation software suite. However, the GUI of the boat navigation application gets loaded each time that the BlueChart map program is startup.

Comment

To avoid this issue, parent your BlueChart map programs folder to the Programs folder (on nemo) and expressly name the BlueChart map program in that folder instead of in Applications.



Solution:

Create a designated subfolder under Programs for your BlueChart map programs. Name the subfolder accordingly and navigate to it from the Applications folder. Make sure that you name the BlueChart map program in this newly created subfolder appropriately (e.g. "Nemo Maps"), and launch it from this new location only.




Hope this helps!

Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the wind capture function is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the wind capture function is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

If you are experiencing issues with the Mercury Wind Capture function, it is likely that an error is occurring while the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is trying to use that functionality. There are a few ways to try and diagnostic this issue:
- temporarily disabling other features of the software can help to isolate which aspect of the software is causing the issue; for example, turning off radar or charting
- if you are using a version of the software from previous to (6.x) then you may need to update your computer and/or driver in order for the Mercury wind feature to work

Comment

; please refer to the Mercury Boat Navigation software Suite user guide for more information



If you are experiencing issues with the Mercury Wind Capture function, it is likely that an error is occurring while the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is trying to use that functionality. There are a few ways to try and diagnostic this issue:


- temporarily disabling other features of the software can help to isolate which aspect of the software is causing the issue; for example, turning off radar or charting

- if you are using a version of the software from previous to (6.x) then you may need to update your computer and/or driver in order for the Mercury wind feature to work; please refer to the Mercury Boat Navigation software Suite user guide for more information

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:changing the maps
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix: changing the maps is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: changing the maps is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: changing the maps is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, when I try to change the maps using the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application, I get an error message that says "Changing maps is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application." Can you help me fix this problem?

Comment

Yes, we can help you fix this problem. To do so, please follow these instructions:


1. Quit the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application by clicking on the "X" in the top-left corner of the window.

2. In the Mercury's File Manager, locate and any *.gdoc files that were created in connection with the Guidare Boat Navigation Suite application. Notice that these files may have a .dc or .md file extension. If so, delete these files from your computer.

3. Re-create all of the *.gdoc files that were deleted in step 2, but this time use a different filename extension for each file – for example, *.proj instead of *.gdoc.

4. Start the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application and issue the following commands to map your Mercury: gridir= ; lonlat= ; The option specifies where your Mercurys latitude/longitude Maps will be saved (by default it is in the \"Documents\" folder under your user account). The option specifies where on earth you want to begin mapping (by default it is at 38°52′N 100°49′W ).

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting the sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I have a Mercury Monterey and the sonar connected to the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite is erroring. I've tried uninstalling, reinstalling, rebooting my computer, and nothing seems to work. I've tried different USB ports and it still does the same thing.

Comment

Hi! We've had reports of users with the Mercury Monterey experiencing trouble connecting to the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite. Depending on the issue, users have tried uninstalling, reinstalling, rebooting the computer, and even using different USB ports. Unfortunately, all of these techniques seem to have failed to resolve the issue. We're doing our best to find out more about what might be causing it and if there is a workaround. Meanwhile, if you experience any issues with Guidare Boat Navigation software suite, please let us know so we can investigate. Thank you for your patience.

Comment

-Make sure that the Mercury is properly installed with its latest software update
-If using Guided Boat Navigation Software Suite (GBNS) 102004 or above, update your software
-Verify the Garmin GPS antenna location
- ensure the Mercury bluetooth connection is up to date and free of typos and malicious software
-Check for... bait fouls interfering wiht fishfinder operation

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I've had my mercury for almost 6 months now and the connecting to the internal wifi is constantly erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. I've tried numerous forums and interventions with no luck.. is there a way to fix this?

Comment

One potential cause of a problem connecting to the internal WiFi network may be configuration issues on your part. Try checking your connection settings and117 Jr Mercury Opt C4 SLYR 5PT Sport Utility 4WD918n updating your wireless hardware if needed. Additionally, make sure you have the latest version of the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite installed 119 Jr Mercury Opt C4 SLYR 5PT Sport Utility 4WD918n. If those steps don't solve the problem, there may be a physical issue with your mercury that needs to be addressed. Please Contact Us for more assistance.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Description:

I am having trouble connecting to my sonar on my Mercury Monterey. It says 'connecting to sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.'

Comment

The most likely cause of this issue is that you are missing another critical component to your Mercury Monterey's nav installation - a geographic data compatible CDRom. If you do not have this media, please contact your non-technical support agent.

If you already have a geographic data compatible CDRom in your Mercury Monterey, but are still experiencing the 'connecting to sonar is erroring...' message, then there may be blocking issues on your part with regards to connecting to the satellite. Try receiving the navigation signals through an alternative means such as wi-fi or 3g cellular service. If nothing else works, please Contact Mercury Technical Support for assistance with resolving this problem.

Specifically, is the tracker going haywire periodically or within a specific time span and what seems to be triggering the problem? Additionally, have you tried turning on/off different features of the application in order to rule out anything as a potential cause? If so, which features did you try and why? Lastly, can you tell me where else on your computer (excluding the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application) you may be running programs concurrently that may be causing interference? Thanks for providing your feedback.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:disable the wind capture function
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: disable the wind capture function is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: disable the wind capture function is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: disable the wind capture function is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is reporting an error disabling the wind capture function. This issue appears to be related to a missing file from the C:/Program Files (x86)/MAPPSOG server installation.

Comment

The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application relies on a Wind capture function to generate route data. If this function is not enabled on the Mapping and Positioning Server installation, the application will report an error disabling the wind capture function. To resolve the issue, install the Wind capture function from the Mapping and Positioning Server installation.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:changing the maps
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: changing the maps is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: changing the maps is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: changing the maps is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Every time I try to change the maps, it errors out the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

1. Make sure that the Maps application is up to date - often updates will available that fix errors or improve performance.
2. Try using a different Wi-Fi network - if you areurfing the web and cannot get online access, try connecting to a different network. 3. Verify that your Library card is actually inserted into the device - sometimes cards can be accidentally reinserted in the opposite position. 4. Check to see if you have any other applications running in the background - if something else is stealing cycles or preventing Maps from working correctly, it may need to be closed. 5. Make sure your device has enough Battery life - this isn't always easy to measure, but if your Maps are taking longer than usual to start up or sufficient time elapses before anerror message pops-up, suggestions for boosting battery life may be required (see our article here).

How do i fix: mapping a new route is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: mapping a new route is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Mapping a new route is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

First, check to make sure the route you are trying to map is actually reachable. Sometimes smaller islands can be missed when navigation is done using a predetermined route. If the destination isn't within range, there may not be an approved method of navigation available to you. Next, check to make sure that your device can actually reach the destination you are trying to reach. Different areas have different equipment requirements, so it is important to verify everything before beginning. Finally, map using the most up-to-date maps and charts available. With current technology, many incidents can be navigated without assistance from Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

createCase

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: connecting the sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting the sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The connecting the sonar is erroring lets you connect the sonar. However, sometimes when you try to connect the sonar, it erroring (the software does not recognize the command) and prevents you from using the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. There is usually an easy fix for this: 一是重新 ADSK scan 或者使用 recently used dasd scan，如果试图连接船长机加载卡时存在该问题。重新 ADSK 以便检查应用是否已经编辑过的对数据包。如果没有引导已经出现蓝色光标右下角的话，则要利用recently used dasd scan来检查相关信息。 这两个办法都是通过使用 GUI 控制台监听船长机在执行 ADSK 检测并更新数据库中心状态 的方式才能帮助尝试解决问题。

Comment

createCase

How do i fix: enabling the autopilot is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Problem

How do i fix: enabling the autopilot is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I am experiencing an issue where the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is unable to enable the autopilot. I have tried restarting my computer, uninstalling and reinstalling the software, androiding my device, but no matter what I do the autopilot still won't work.

Comment

This sounds like it might be a software issue. Try reinstalling the software or trying a different download. If that doesn't work, please let us know more about your computer setup and what actions you took.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:enabling the fishfinder
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Some users are reporting that the Fishfinder ENABLING window is freezing the application and they need to restart it in order to be able to use it. This problem seems to occur when trying to enable the fishfinder using an Administrative User right in the gaf390pro.ini file. To try and workaround this, a member of the technical support team has developed a tool that will reformat the gaf390pro.ini file for those who have been having problems enabling the fishfinder. This solution may work for some but not all users, so it's important to check if it works before posting about it on the web forum or sending an email to IBM's technical support team. Thanks for your patience as we look into this issue.

Comment

We are currently investigating a problem where some users are experiencing the Fishfinder ENABLING window freezing and they need to restart the application in order to use it. At this time, we have developed a tool that will reformat the gaf390pro.ini file for those who have been reporting this issue. If you have been having difficulty enabling the Fishfinder and have tried thetool mentioned above, please let us know if it has worked for you or not. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and thank you for your patience as we work to resolve this issue.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:connecting to the internal wifi
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

When trying to connect to the internal wifi network on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite (GNS) application, I am getting an error message stating "Connection to the wifi network is erroring." I have tried pressing the reset button on my router and re-installing the GNS application, but neither of these attempts have worked. Could you advise as to what I can do to fix this issue?

Comment

First, it’s possible that your system is configured to use a wireless network that isn't supported by the GNS software. Check the version number of the software and make sure that your system or firmware is up to date. If you don’t have any wireless networks available in your area, you may need to buy a USB wireless adapter for your system. In addition, it's possible that you're not properly activating the wireless adapter on your system. Double-check to see if your system is broadcasting its name and SSID (network name) loudly and distinctly from each of the ESS points travelled through during setup. Finally, if you're connecting from inside a building, it's possible that there are nearby metal objects causing interference. Try installing a shield around your computer so metal objects are blocked from your signal.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:connecting to sonar
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: connecting to sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: connecting to sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The user is able to open Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite but getting a "connecting to sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application" message.

Comment

There could be many reasons why this might be happening, but the most likely one is that there is a problem with your sonar. As long as you can access your sonar system and it is operational, try checking the following:
- Make sure both your sonar unit and Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite software are fully updated
- Try adjusting your sonar's altitude and range settings if needed
- Check for any obstructions in your sonar field of view (may be caused by humps or bulkheads in your boat, for example)

createPDFDocument

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:0.8
Length:500

Installation manual for: Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite (Version: 1), model: Mercury.

Main Software Buttons.

Home
Route
Maps
Settings
FishFinder
Quit

List of available Software screens.

Main
Navigation
Radar Map
Maps and Charts
Tides and Currents
FishFinder
Wind and Weather
Settings

Screen: Main

The screen is the main window of the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. It displays the navigation information for the boat and provides various tools for controlling the navigation.

Screen: Navigation

The screen is used to navigate with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Screen: Radar Map

The screen displays a radar map with the guidance boat navigation software suite. The software suite provides real-time navigation and charting information for vessels in coastal waters.

Screen: Maps and Charts

The screen is used to display maps and charts with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Screen: Tides and Currents

The screen displays tidal information and current conditions for a particular location. The user can select a desired location and view the data for that location or select a different location. The screen also provides navigation information, including estimated time of arrival at the selected location and recommended course changes.

Screen: FishFinder

The screen is used to provide information about the environment around the boat, including water temperature, depth, and location of nearby landmarks. The screen also provides guidance to the user on how to navigate to specific locations.

Screen: Wind and Weather

The screen provides information about the wind and weather conditions.

Screen: Settings

A screen is used to display information.

List of available Menus.

Homescreen
Autopilot control
Chart app
Weather mode
Sonar app
Radar app

Menu: Homescreen

The Homescreen menu in Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite allows you to access various features of the software. The main features are:

-The Navigate button allows you to navigate the boat using the on-screen map.
-The Settings button allows you to configure the navigation settings.
-The Route Planner button allows you to plan a route using the on-screen map and navigation instructions.
-The History button allows you to review the last navigation steps.

Sub Menu: User Profiles

To open the Homescreen, select "Homescreen" from the main menu. The Homescreen displays all of the features and options of Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. To access User Profiles, select "User Profiles" from the main menu. The User Profiles screen displays all of the user profiles currently active on your computer. To add or delete a user profile, click on the user profile you want to modify and select "Add User Profile" or "Delete User Profile," as appropriate.

Sub Menu: Settings

The Homescreen is where you access the main features of Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. On the left side of the screen are icons for various functions, such as navigating, viewing maps, and recording your journey. The top of the screen displays the current location and direction of travel. The bottom of the screen offers shortcuts to commonly used functions.

To access the Settings menu, click on the three lines in the top left corner of the screen. From here, you can change various settings related to navigation, map display, recordings, and more.

Sub Menu: Man Overboard

To use the Homescreen:
1. Open Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.
2. On the Homescreen, click the "Homescreen" button.
3. On the "Homescreen," you will see a list of icons on the left side of the screen.
4. Click on an icon to open its menu.
5. On the "Menu" for an icon, you will see options that depend on what type of icon it is:
- Maps: Choose which maps to view on your device.
- Settings: Change settings related to how Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite works.
- Devices: Manage devices connected to your computer.
- Favorites: Add icons to your Homescreen so you can easily access them later.
6. To exit an icon's menu, click its "X" in the top right corner of the screen.
7. To move an icon around on your Homescreen, drag it with your finger.
8. To close Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, click the "X" in the top right corner of the screen.

Sub Menu: Alarms

The Homescreen is the main screen of the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. On the Homescreen you will find:
- The main navigation window.
- The main toolbar.
- The dock list.
- The map.
- The preferences window.
- The help window.
- The settings window.
- The log window.
The main navigation window is where you will be navigating your boat. It displays your current position and direction, as well as the estimated time of arrival at your destination. You can also use the menus on the right side of the navigation window to change settings, open docks, or access other functions of the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. The toolbar at the top of the navigation window contains buttons for common tasks such as navigating to a dock, viewing your map, or opening the preferences window. The dock list on the left side of the navigation window lists all of the docks in your vicinity. You can click on a dock to view information about it, such as its name and location. The map on the right side of the navigation window displays a 3D representation of your surroundings, including any docks that are close to your current location. You can use the arrow keys on your keyboard to move around in this map, and you can zoom in or out using the mousewheel or double-click on the map area. The preferences window lets you customize many aspects of how the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite works. For example, you can change how long it takes for your boat to reach a dock after you enter its coordinates, or how accurate the navigation calculations are. The help window provides brief instructions about various features of the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. The log window records all of the events that happen while you are using it, including when you enter coordinates into the navigation window, what docks were selected as destinations, and how long it took for your boat to reach those docks.

Sub Menu: GPS Settings

The Homescreen is where you access all of the features of the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. On the left side of the screen is a list of icons, each representing a different function of the software.

To access the GPS Settings menu, first make sure that your boat is properly aligned and properly plugged into your dock’s power source. Then, on the Homescreen, click on the GPS Settings icon. This will open the GPS Settings menu.

On the GPS Settings menu, you will see four tabs: Map, Chart, Data, and Preferences.

The Map tab displays a map of your current location and surrounding area. The Chart tab displays a chart of your current location and surrounding area. The Data tab displays information about your boat, including its speed, position, and heading. The Preferences tab allows you to customize various settings related to the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Sub Menu: Status Area

The Homescreen displays all the important information about the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. The Status Area menu provides quick access to different functions of the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Sub Menu: Sidebar

The Homescreen:
1. Launch the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.
2. On the Homescreen, click the "Homescreen" button to open the main navigation screen.
3. On the Homescreen, click the "Sidebar" button to open the sidebar menu.
4. Click the "Guidare Boat Navigation" icon to open the Guidare Boat Navigation screen.
5. On the Guidare Boat Navigation screen, you can:
- View your current position and speed on a map;
- Set your desired destination and course;
- View information about your boat, such as fuel levels and water temperature;
- Use the "Help" button to get help with navigation;
- Switch between portrait and landscape mode;
- Close the Guidare Boat Navigation screen by clicking the "X" in the top right corner.
The Sidebar Menu with Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite:
1. On the Homescreen, click the "Sidebar" button to open the sidebar menu.
2. Click the "Guidare Boat Navigation" icon to open the Guidare Boat Navigation screen.
3. On the Guidare Boat Navigation screen, you can:
- View your current position and speed on a map;
- Change your desired destination and course;
- View information about your boat, such as fuel levels and water temperature;
- Use the "Help" button to get help with navigation;
- Switch between portrait and landscape mode;
- Close the Guidare Boat Navigation screen by clicking the "X" in the top right corner.

Menu: Autopilot control

The Autopilot control menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite allows you to configure various Autopilot settings, including:

- Course: You can set the desired course for the boat.
- Speed: You can set the desired speed for the boat.
- Headings: You can set the desired heading for the boat.
- Rudder Angle: You can adjust the rudder angle to keep the boat on its desired course.

Sub Menu: Locked heading

The Autopilot control is used to set the boat's heading and speed. The Locked heading menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite allows you to lock the boat's heading so that you can keep track of your destination while cruising.

Sub Menu: Navigation

The Autopilot control is used to set the vessel’s heading and speed. The Navigation menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is used to display the current position, course, and speed of the vessel.

Sub Menu: Disengaging the autopilot

To use the Autopilot control:



1. Open the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite and select the Autopilot tab.
2. To engage or disengage the autopilot, click on the button next to the Autopilot icon.
3. To change the autopilot settings, click on the arrow next to the Autopilot icon and select between Speed, Course, and Heading settings.

Menu: Chart app

The Chart app menu is a convenient way to access the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. To open the Chart app menu, click on the "Menu" button on the toolbar, and then click on "Chart." The Chart app menu will appear.

To open the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, click on the "Tools" button on the toolbar, and then click on "Guidare Boat Navigation." The Guidare Boat Navigation window will appear.

Sub Menu: Modes

The Chart app is used to view charts of a particular area or type. The Modes menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite can be used to change the navigation mode, set waypoints, and more.

Sub Menu: Vessel details

The Chart app allows you to view a variety of charts and maps, including coastal and inland navigation charts. You can also use the Vessel details menu to access the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite includes features such as GPS navigation, chart plotting, and electronic chart display.

Sub Menu: View and motion

The Chart app is used to view charts and graphs of your boat's position and speed. The View menu is used to change the chart's display mode, zoom in or out, and change the chart's orientation. The motion menu is used to control the boat's speed and direction using the rudder, throttle, and wheel. The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite includes a map application that can be used to view your boat's location on a map, as well as track your boat's current position and course.

Sub Menu: Placing a waypoint

The Chart app is used to create and edit charts. With the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, you can place a waypoint menu on the map screen. You can then select the waypoint from the menu and use the keyboard to enter the coordinates.

Sub Menu: Creating a route

The Chart app is an app that you can use to view charts of different types. You can use it to view charts of the area around you, or you can use it to create routes.

To create a route with the Chart app, first open the Chart app and locate the map that you want to use for your route. Then, tap on the map to open it in full screen.

Next, locate the route that you want to create. You can do this by tapping on the route marker that appears next to the route that you want to create.

Then, tap on the blue button that appears next to the “Create Route” button. This will open a menu where you can select the type of chart that you want to use for your route.

You can choose from a variety of different charts, including nautical charts, aeronautical charts, and road maps. Once you have selected the type of chart that you want to use, tap on the “Create Route” button again.

This will open a new window where you will be able to enter your route details. You will need to specify the starting point and ending point of your route, as well as any navigational points that you will be using along your route.

You can also add notes about your route if you wish. Finally, tap on the “Create Route” button again to finish creating your route.

Sub Menu: Autorouting

To use the Chart app, first open it and select the map you want to view.
Then tap on the "Options" icon in the top left corner of the screen.
Under "Map Type", choose "Chart".
Under "Chart Options", you can change the map scale, zoom level and type of map.
You can also change the background color and transparency of the map.
You can also add markers to the map by tapping on the "+" icon in the bottom right corner of the screen.
To view Autorouting information, tap on the "Autorouting" icon in the top left corner of the screen.
Tap on "Configure Autorouting".
Select your destination from the list and set your start point.
Tap on "Configure Route".
Select your departure port and set your arrival port.
Tap on "Configure Route Options".
You can configure your route preferences such as speed limit, detour options and more.
When you're finished configuring your route, tap on "Route Info".
Your route will now be displayed on the map with estimated time and distance to your destination.

Sub Menu: Create a track

The Chart app is a free app that can be downloaded from the App Store or Google Play. When you open the Chart app, you will see a map of your current location. On the left side of the screen, you will see different types of charts. The Chart app has charts for water, land, air, and satellite. To use the Chart app to create a track menu, first select the type of chart you want to use.

Next, tap on the map to zoom in. Tap on the area of the map where you want to start your track. Next, tap on the blue line that represents your starting point. You can drag the blue line around to create a track. When you are finished creating your track, tap on the green check mark in the upper-right corner of the screen.

To add a stop to your track, tap on the blue line that represents your destination point. Next, tap on the green check mark in the lower-right corner of the screen. You can also add notes about your track in the notes field located below the stop and destination points.

To view your track menu on a larger scale, double-tap on one of the stops or destinations in your track menu. You can also zoom out by using pinch gestures on either side of the screen.

Menu: Weather mode

The Weather mode menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite allows you to view current weather conditions, forecast conditions for the next 24 hours, and access your saved locations.

Sub Menu: Modes

The Weather mode lets you view current weather conditions, forecasts, and advisories for a specific location. You can also access the weather map and track the weather conditions over time.

To use the Modes menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, first open the Modes menu by pressing the Mode button on the main toolbar. Then select Weather from the list of modes. The Weather screen will appear, as shown in Figure 1.


Figure 1: The Weather screen in the Modes menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

On this screen, you can view current weather conditions, forecasts, and advisories for a specific location. To access these features, click on the appropriate link. For example, to view current weather conditions for your current location, click on the Current Conditions link. This will open the Current Conditions screen, as shown in Figure 2.


Figure 2: The Current Conditions screen in the Modes menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

On this screen, you can see information about temperature and humidity levels, wind speed and direction, barometric pressure, and visibility at your current location. You can also access the weather map and track the weather conditions over time. To close this screen, press the Close button on the toolbar.

To view forecasts for your current location, click on the Forecast link on the Current Conditions screen. This will open the Forecast screen, as shown in Figure 3.


Figure 3: The Forecast screen in the Modes menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

On this screen, you can see information about temperature and humidity levels, wind speed and direction, barometric pressure, and visibility for your current location over a period of up to seven days. You can also access a detailed forecast for your selected location (by clicking on its name in the list box). To close this screen, press the Close button on the toolbar.

To view advisories for your current location, click on the Advisories link on the Current Conditions screen. This will open the Advisories screen, as shown in Figure 4.


Figure 4: The Advisories screen in the Modes menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

On this screen, you can see information about marine weather hazards (such as thunderstorms) that may affect your area over a period of up to seven days. You can also access a warning message about a specific hazard (by clicking

Sub Menu: Animated weather

The Weather mode in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite allows you to view current weather conditions, forecasts, and advisories for a certain area. You can also access animated weather maps that show current conditions for a certain area.

Menu: Sonar app

To use the Sonar app menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite:
1. Open the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.
2. Click "Settings" on the main menu.
3. Click "Sonar" on the Settings menu.
4. Select the sonar type you want to use from the drop-down menu.
5. Enter your desired sonar depth and speed in the appropriate fields.
6. Click "Start." The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite will start scanning for objects and display their positions on the screen.
7. To change the sonar depth or speed, click on the corresponding buttons on the screen.

Sub Menu: Modes

The Sonar app is used to view the surroundings and navigate. The Modes menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is used to change settings for the sonar and navigation.

Sub Menu: 3D Controls

The Sonar app is used to view and navigate using sound waves. The 3D Controls menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite allows you to zoom in and out, pan left and right, as well as change the viewing angle.

Sub Menu: Sonar Channels

The Sonar app is used to view the sonar image and to select a channel. The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is used to navigate the boat.

Menu: Radar app

The Radar app menu is located in the main menu of Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. To open the Radar app menu, click on "Menu" in the main toolbar and select "Radar."

To use the Radar app menu, first select a destination or a point on the map. The app will show you all available radar stations near your selected location. You can also use the app to display weather conditions, marine traffic, and other information about the area.

You can also use the Radar app menu to control various features of Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. For example, you can change the map view, zoom in or out, and toggle between satellite and land images.

Sub Menu: Modes

The Radar app is used to view the surrounding area and map out a route. The Modes menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite can be used to toggle between different modes, including map mode, speed mode, and compass mode.

Sub Menu: Controls

1. Open the Radar app and select the "Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite" icon on the main screen.

2. On the Controls menu, click on the "Radar" tab to open the Radar screen.

3. Drag your cursor over the area you want to map and wait for the blue outline to appear. This will show you the boundaries of the area you are mapping.

4. To move your cursor around, use your fingers to drag it around. You can also use the arrow keys on your keyboard to move your cursor.

5. When you have finished mapping the area, press the "Done" button.

Sub Menu: AIS targets

To use the Radar app:
1. Open the Radar app and sign in.
2. In the main menu, select "Targets."
3. In the Targets menu, select "AIS."
4. In the AIS targets menu, select "Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite."
5. Select a target from the list and click on its icon to open its details.
6. To view the target's track history, select "History."
7. To view the target's current position, select "Position."
8. To change the target's heading, select "Heading."
9. To change the target's speed, select "Speed."

Sub Menu: Guard zone alarms

The Radar app is used to view the surrounding area and identify objects. The Guard zone alarms menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite can be used to set up alarms that will notify you when you enter or exit a predetermined safety zone.

Sub Menu: FishFinder

The Radar app is used to view real-time radar images of your surrounding area. The FishFinder menu with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite can be used to plot a route, find fish and other marine life, and more.

How to setup the Wifi on the device.

The Guidare Boat Navigation Suite includes a wireless network adapter and our free app. You will need to connect the adapter to your computer, open the app, and follow the prompts to set up your network. Once connected, you can use our app to view real-time map data or navigate using your existing route plans.

Troubleshooting.

If you are having trouble with Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, please try the following:

1. Make sure that you have the latest version of the software installed.

2. If you are having trouble connecting to the Guidare server, make sure that your computer has an active Internet connection and that you have configured your browser to use the correct protocol (http:// or https://).

3. If you are still having trouble, please contact our customer service team for assistance.

Release notes for version 1.

1

Version 1.1 of Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite introduces support for Alexa Voice Service and updates the user interface.

This release also includes the following changes:
- Updated user interface to include support for Alexa Voice Service.
- Improvements to the map rendering, including better performance when zoomed in or out.
- Bug fixes.

Related parts.

Operator Panel
GPS
Radar
Sonar
Panoptix Sonar
Sensors

createWordDocument

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:0.8
Length:500

Product Information sheet for: Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite (Version: 1), model: Mercury.

Description.

The product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is a software suite that includes a boat navigation system, a map database, and a web-based user interface. The boat navigation system provides users with real-time navigation information for their boats, including current speed, heading, and location. The map database includes detailed maps of various waterways around the world, allowing users to easily find their way around. The web-based user interface allows users to access their navigation data and maps from any computer with internet access.

Overview.

Connect to your favorite third-party devices
Navigate any waters with preloaded mapping and coastal charts
Manage your marine experience from nearly anywhere
Connect traditional and scanning sonars
Panoptix Sonar support
BlueChart and Vision Chart support
Built in Wifi
FishFinder

Highlights.

Connect To Your Favorite Third Party Devices

This feature allows users to connect to their favorite devices, such as a GPS device, in order to view detailed navigation information. This is helpful for ensuring that the user receives the most accurate guidance possible while underway.

Navigate Any Waters With Preloaded Mapping And Coastal Charts

This feature allows users to navigate through waterways and coastal waters without having to manually enter data. The software suite includes preloaded mapping and charts that allow users to easily navigate their boat.

Manage Your Marine Experience From Nearly Anywhere

The Manage Your Marine Experience feature allows you to manage your marine experience from nearly anyplace in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. This includes accessing your boat’s current location, speed, heading, and other navigation data; configuring your boat’s settings; and managing your marine insurance policies.

Connect Traditional And Scanning Sonars

This feature allows users to connect their traditional sonars (e.g., an echo sounder) and scanning sonars (e.g., a multibeam echosounder) to the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite. This permits users to view data from both types of sonars simultaneously on the same screen, which can help them make more informed decisions when navigating.

Panoptix Sonar Support

The feature " in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite" allows users to use a Panoptix sonar unit in their boat to improve navigation and assessment of their naval assets.

Bluechart And Vision Chart Support

The Bluechart and Vision Chart Support in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite provides users with the ability to view charts and navigation data on a computer or mobile device. This feature allows users to plan their voyage using detailed maps and information, as well as track their progress using real-time visualizations.

Built In Wifi

The built in wifi in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite allows users to connect to the internet and access the Guidare Boat Navigation software without connecting to a wireless network. This is useful for when there is no available wireless network or when the user wants to keep their wireless connection private.

Fishfinder

The in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is a software that allows the user to find and track fish in open water.

Related parts.

Operator Panel
GPS
Radar
Sonar
Panoptix Sonar
Sensors

createWebsite

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:0.8
Length:500

Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite (Version: 1), for model: Mercury.

Specific for model: Mercury

Software version: 1

Description

The product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is a software suite that includes a boat navigation system, a map database, and a web-based user interface. The boat navigation system provides users with real-time navigation information for their boats, including current speed, heading, and location. The map database includes detailed maps of various waterways around the world, allowing users to easily find their way around. The web-based user interface allows users to access their navigation data and maps from any computer with internet access.

Features.

  • Connect To Your Favorite Third Party Devices

  • Navigate Any Waters With Preloaded Mapping And Coastal Charts

  • Manage Your Marine Experience From Nearly Anywhere

  • Connect Traditional And Scanning Sonars

  • Panoptix Sonar Support

  • Bluechart And Vision Chart Support

  • Built In Wifi

  • Fishfinder

Connect To Your Favorite Third Party Devices

This feature allows users to connect to their favorite devices, such as a GPS device, in order to view detailed navigation information. This is helpful for ensuring that the user receives the most accurate guidance possible while underway.

Navigate Any Waters With Preloaded Mapping And Coastal Charts

This feature allows users to navigate through waterways and coastal waters without having to manually enter data. The software suite includes preloaded mapping and charts that allow users to easily navigate their boat.

Manage Your Marine Experience From Nearly Anywhere

The Manage Your Marine Experience feature allows you to manage your marine experience from nearly anyplace in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. This includes accessing your boat’s current location, speed, heading, and other navigation data; configuring your boat’s settings; and managing your marine insurance policies.

Connect Traditional And Scanning Sonars

This feature allows users to connect their traditional sonars (e.g., an echo sounder) and scanning sonars (e.g., a multibeam echosounder) to the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite. This permits users to view data from both types of sonars simultaneously on the same screen, which can help them make more informed decisions when navigating.

Panoptix Sonar Support

The feature " in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite" allows users to use a Panoptix sonar unit in their boat to improve navigation and assessment of their naval assets.

Bluechart And Vision Chart Support

The Bluechart and Vision Chart Support in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite provides users with the ability to view charts and navigation data on a computer or mobile device. This feature allows users to plan their voyage using detailed maps and information, as well as track their progress using real-time visualizations.

Built In Wifi

The built in wifi in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite allows users to connect to the internet and access the Guidare Boat Navigation software without connecting to a wireless network. This is useful for when there is no available wireless network or when the user wants to keep their wireless connection private.

Fishfinder

The in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is a software that allows the user to find and track fish in open water.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for the device is stuck on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Regards, Aaliyah Mclaughlin.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for the device is stuck on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Regards, Aaliyah Mclaughlin.

Symptoms

I have a software title called Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. The device is stuck on the welcome screen and I can't access any other menus. Can you help me fix this problem?

Comment

There could be a number of reasons why your device is stuck on the welcome screen: an improperly formatted USB, improper installation, wrong software title, or an incorrect pin number. If you can't access any other menus and the device is plugged in to an outlet and working properly, it may be an issue with the device's battery or memory. If possible, we recommend visiting our website or contact us by email to troubleshoot further.

I need a fix for i have a blank screen on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Regards, Aaron Jaramillo.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for i have a blank screen on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Regards, Aaron Jaramillo.

Symptoms

Hi! I've been unable to use my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite for awhile now because every time I try to open it up, I get a blank screen. Apparently there is something wrong with the program because it's not working no matter what I do. Is there anything I can do to fix this?

Comment

Check that your computer is properly installed and up-to-date with the latest Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite software and patches. Go to http://support.guidare.com/en-us/default.aspx to get started on a troubleshooting process. You may also need to reinstall the software on your computer if it is not up-to-date or if there are any problems with installation. For more information, please see our support article: https://support.guidare.com/kb/exploring-guideare-insanely-simple-boat-navigation/.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for the progress bar keeps spinning on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Regards, Abdullah Simon.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for the progress bar keeps spinning on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Regards, Abdullah Simon.

Symptoms

The progress bar in Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite keeps spinning, leading to frustration and confusion. This problem is caused by an issue with the software's Timeline bar.

Comment

There is no problem with the Timeline bar! However, if you are having difficulty following the progress of your voyage, you can try one or more of the following solutions:
- Make sure that you are calibrating your Ipir 80 chronometer when you first install the software. This will ensure that your journey•s progress is accurate. (Click on the Options·Profile button and follow the instructions.)
- Click on the Tools·Options toolbar button and select Preferences from the menu that appears. On the General tab, make sure that Saved Paths is set to On. This will save your current path in the navigation software so that you can quickly reload it when you finish your voyage.
- If none of these solutions work for you, please contact customer support for more help.
