createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:there is no connection to the sensors
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:I need a fix for [KEYWORD] on my [PRODUCT]. Regards, Abram Mckee.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: I need a fix for there is no connection to the sensors on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Regards, Abram Mckee.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for there is no connection to the sensors on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Regards, Abram Mckee.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for there is no connection to the sensors on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Regards, Abram Mckee.

Symptoms

Hello,
I have a problem with the sensors on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. I cannot connect to them in order to update the software. Is there anything I can do to fix this?

Comment

There could be a number of reasons behind your difficulty connecting to the sensors, so it's important that you troubleshoot the issue. Start by checking whether you're able to properly access the boat's internet connection and Rapport software. If those are both working correctly, make sure you know how to correctly connect to the sensors. Additionally, it's possible that something is blocking your sensor connection. To confirm that there isn't a problem with the sensors themselves, try resetting them and/or downloading the latest software update from Guidare's website. If all of these solutions fail to resolve the issue, you'll need to contact Guidare for assistance.

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for cannot connect to Panoptix device on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Regards, Abril Herrera.

Symptoms

Hi!

I am having trouble connecting to the Panoptix device on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. I've tried both the Bluetooth and WiFi connection methods, but neither of them are working. Is there a specific problem I'm encountering?

Comment

The Panoptix device might not be compatible with your Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. If you have a newer version of the software, it might has updated to include the Panoptix device. Alternatively, you might need to re-install the software in order for it to detect and use the Panoptix device. If that still doesn't work, please reach out to Guidare Support for help testing and resolving the issue.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for cannot connect other devices on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Regards, Ace Mata.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for cannot connect other devices on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Regards, Ace Mata.

Symptoms

I have an older 'Guidare Boat Navigation Suite' software on my PC and recently got a new laptop. I tried to use the software to connect to the boat's // wireless capabilities but it says "Cannot Connect Other Devices." However, my old laptop still connected fine. Can you help me fix this problem?

Comment

There could be a number of reasons that your current laptop is not able to "connect other devices" with the older Guidare Boat Navigation Suite software installed; however, the most likely reason is that the computer no longer has the compatible wireless hardware required. In this case, you may need to either: A) Purchase a new laptop that has the latest wireless hardware, or B) Reinstall the older Guidare Boat Navigation Suite software on your new laptop in order to reconnect to the old computer's ancient wireless capabilities.

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the device is stuck. Thanks, Kinslee Acosta.

Symptoms

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the device is stuck. I can't "Refresh" or "Hide" any of the screens.

Comment

Dear ____,


Thank you for contacting us regarding the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. We are sorry to hear that you are experiencing issue with the software. If you have previously enabled some of the security measures in your device then it might be prevented from refreshing or hiding certain screens. Alternatively, if the device is newly bought and still not activating – please contact customer service for troubleshooting options. In the meantime, we advise you to restart the device and try activating the software again. Thank you for using Guidare!

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, there is a blinking red led. Thanks, Beckham Adams.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, there is a blinking red led. Thanks, Beckham Adams.

Symptoms

There is a blinking red light on the top right-hand corner of my mercury's instrument panel (that is visible with the car windows down). It doesn't do anything and I can't find a way to turn it off. Can you help?

Comment

There could be many different causes for a blinking red light on a car's instrument panel. One possibilities is that the instrument panel fuse has blown. This can usually be fixed by replacing the fuse. If the instrument panel light is related to a warning light like the hazard or recall light, then the problem may need to be diagnosed by a mechanic.

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the progress bar keeps spinning.

Comment

There could be a number of reasons why the Boat Navigation Software Suite may be causing the progress bar to spin on your Mercury. Additional troubleshooting steps can include verifying that the software is installed properly, checking the settings for your Mercury's monitor, and verifying that thedevice is connected to wifi or cellular service. If all of these steps fail to resolve the issue, please submit a support ticket and our team of engineers will be happy to help you out.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:the map is not being displayed
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:When using the product [PRODUCT] on my [BOAT], [KEYWORD]. Thanks, Addisyn Golden.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the map is not being displayed. Thanks, Addisyn Golden.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the map is not being displayed. Thanks, Addisyn Golden.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the map is not being displayed. Thanks, Addisyn Golden.

Symptoms

Your problem is with the map displayed in Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite (GBNS). GBNS requires access to GPS satellites for accurate navigation. If your GPS receiver does not have a good signal, or if you are in an area with poor real-time reception, the map will not display.

Comment

Unfortunately, GBNS does not currently allow for alternate navigation solutions, such as land maps or paper charts. If you need to use an alternate navigation method, you will likely have to stick with a software package designed for land navigation. There are many excellent options available, both free and paid.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:there is no connection to the sensors
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:When using the product [PRODUCT] on my [BOAT], [KEYWORD]. Thanks, Addyson Walters.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, there is no connection to the sensors. Thanks, Addyson Walters.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, there is no connection to the sensors. Thanks, Addyson Walters.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, there is no connection to the sensors. Thanks, Addyson Walters.

Symptoms

The product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite does not seem to connect with the sensors installed on my Mercury. I thought that since the software was designed for use on smaller boats, the Bluetooth and embedded sensor connection would be more reliable than if used on a larger vessel.

Comment

There could be several reasons why the software does not seem to connect with your sensors. First, it's possible that the connection between the software and sensors is successful, but not reliable - in this case, you would receive alerts for hazards as you approach, but the actual position tracking would be intermittently inaccurate. Second, it's possible that the sensors are not compatible with Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Third, it's possible that the relevant settings on your devices are incorrect - please consult the manufacturer's documentation for more information on proper sensor installation and configuration. Finally, it's possible that you may need a new sensor - in which case, please contact the sensor manufacturer for more information on compatibility.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, cannot connect to Panoptix device. Thanks, Adele Wolf.

Symptoms

I am trying to connect my Mercury Lombard (2007) to the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, but I cannot find a way to do it. I have installed the product and followed the instructions, but each time I open the Guidare Boat Navigation software, it says that it cannot connect to the Panoptix device. Any help would be much appreciated. Thanks!

Comment

If you're still having trouble connecting your Mercury Lombard to the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite after following the installation instructions, it might be because you've renamed or deleted the bin\Panoptix directory. 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Guidare Boat Navigation\bin\Panoptix' can be renamed to something like 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Guidare Boat Navigation\MyProjects\bin\Panoptix', and 'C:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\Guidare Boat Navigation\.binn' can be deleted if you wish.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the real time tracker is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Adriana Randall.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the real time tracker is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Adriana Randall.

Symptoms

My Mercury OS becomes unresponsive and therefore shuts down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application after 1-2 minutes of use. I've read online that this issue is generally caused by low or insufficient system memory, but no one has been able to provide a solution. I'm using Windows 7 Professional 64-bit PC.

Comment

I've struggled with this very issue and have found a few minimal solutions.

1. Make a system recovery disk or a clone of your hard drive to restore your system if it fails in the middle of your journey.
2. Disconnect allexternal devices and peripherals, including the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application, and see if that resolves the issue. Close all unnecessary programs and processes before connecting external devices.
3. Verify that you are using the correct drivers for your Mercury OS and hardware device. I'm using Compaq Mercury 6100 laptops with integrated Nvidia graphics, so I downloaded the newest drivers from Nvidia's website for my specific laptop. Updating drivers on a regular basis can resolved intermittently low system memory as well as other more serious hardware issues.
4.. Check to see if there is spyware, malware or adware installed on your computer that may be consuming resources or slowing down your Mercury OS. Remove any suspicious items from your computer and run a diagnostics scan with an appropriate scanner such as Microsoft's Toolkit Offline (offline scan) or Malwarebytes' Anti-Malware Free.

Problem

The only solution I can see is to physically uninstall and reinstall the whole thing. Has anyone else seen this issue and been able to fix it?

Comment

Your Mercury GPS unit had a problem with its vessel identification system. Your best bet for fixing the issue may be to physically uninstall and reinstall the whole Guidare Boat Navigation Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting the sonar is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Aidan Lim.

Symptoms

I have a mercury milan 2003 factory deck that powers the gps and sonar. Recently, I have been experiencing problems with connection between the sonar and gps. The software that runs on the boat for navigating (Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite) would randomly stop working and require me to click on the "reload" button in order for it to work again. Ive tried leaving the gps unit in indefinitely long standby mode in hope it'll somehow connect or reset itself but nothing has worked so far. Can someone tell me how to fix this connecting issue? It's really been causing me some headaches.

Comment

It sounds as if there may be some electrical interference between the sonar and gps unit. If you have another channel on the boat that is not being used for navigation, you could try switching to that channel to see if that resolves the issue. If not, it may be necessary to take the gps unit in for repairs.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Aidan Raymond.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Aidan Raymond.

Symptoms

I was trying to enable my fishfinder on my Mercury Villager and it's shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Is there a way to turn off the fishfinder without turning off the entire navigation system?

Comment

There is not a direct way to turn off your fishfinder without also turning off the navigation system. One option would be to disable the fishfinder automatically when the Villager enters Active Cruising Mode. You could also temporarily disable your fishfinder by pressing the "Fishing Mode" button multiple times until the indicator blinks slowly (it will eventually shut off). If you cannot resolve the issue using these methods, please reach out to Mercury customer service for more assistance.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Ailani Webster.

Symptoms

Hi I am Ailani Webster. My Mercury su pu seems to be shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application when I try to connect to the internal wifi. Can you help me out?

Comment

There could be a few reasons why the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application might be shutting down when you try to connect to the internal wifi, including a malfunctioning or blocked WiFi port, damaged or incompatible wifi adapter, or an incorrect security configuration. If you are having trouble connecting to the internal wifi, we suggest trying to connect to the wifi network using a different device or by changing the security settings on your computer. You can find more information about setting up and connecting to wi-fi networks here:
If you are still having trouble connecting, please email us at support@guidare.com and we would be happy to help investigate the problem further.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to sonar is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Alanna Moore.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to sonar is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Alanna Moore.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, I have found that connecting to sonar is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
I have tried different networks and ports, but it seems that there is something definitely interfering with the connection.
I would love to be able to use the Cat Nav software on my Mercury, but until this issue can be fixed, it is not possible.

Comment

There could be a number of reasons why connecting to sonar might shutdown the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. One possibility is that there is something interfering with the network connection, such as a SturdyWalls firewall or another network hardware device. Another possibility is that the Mercury's Guidare boat navigation software is incompatible with the sonar sensor. If you are unable to connect to sonar simply by trying different ports and networks, please submit your Mercury for factory service for a diagnostic investigation to rule out any underlying hardware or software issues.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the real time tracker is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Alannah Owens.

Symptoms

I have been using the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite for a few years now. Recently I started having problems with it shutting down on me randomly. Sometimes I would be opening the software to try and start using it and it would just close out on me. Occasionally when I do get it working, the real time tracker won't show up at all.

I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling the software, making sure my computer is fully updated, turning off various anti-virus programs, and even changing the settings in my operating system. But nothing has been helping. Is there something I'm missing?

Comment

There could be a number of issues that could cause your software to randomly shut down, including a problem with your computer's hardware or software, or an infection on your computer. In addition, occasionally software updates, changes to your computer's operating system, and even Task Manager cleanups can Impact how the Guidare Boat Navigation software operates. If you have recently upgraded any software or reviewed comprehensive system optimisations and still experience issues with the software, please please try our Quick Diagnosis Tool for troubleshooting common errands.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite

Boat:Mercury

Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is shutting down the [PRODUCT] application. Regards, Alec Roth.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: changing the maps is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Alec Roth.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: changing the maps is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Alec Roth.

Symptoms

The users intending to change the maps in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application are shutting down the software suite. The cause of this problem is not immediately apparent, butAlec Roth suggests that it might be due to a memory issue. If further investigation confirms that the issue is due to the changing of maps, then he suggests that an error message be displayed informing those using the software that they must save their changes prior to closing the software.

Comment

Additionally, he suggests that the software be designed so that users can save their changes without shutting down the software.


Dear customer,

Thank you for reaching out. Unfortunately, we are experiencing an issue where users intending to change the maps in Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite are shutting down the software suite. The cause of this problem is not immediately apparent, but Alec Roth suggests that it might be due to a memory issue. If further investigation confirms that the issue is due to the changing of maps, then he suggests that an error message be displayed informing those using the software that they must save their changes prior to closing the software. Additionally, he suggests that the software be designed so that users can save their changes without shutting down the software. Thank you for your patience while we figure out what is causing this problem. We apologize for any inconvenience you may be experiencing and will do our best to resolve it as soon as possible.

Problem

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Alessandro Tyler.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Alessandro Tyler.

Symptoms

In my house, the integrating router has a WPA2-Enterprise enabled and I bought a certified security adapter. The application says that is has access to the internal wifi, but it suddenly shuts down every few minutes even when there is no communication with the wifi network.

Comment

It sounds like you may have one of the channels in your network cabled incorrectly or your router itself may be faulty. After doing a little detective work and testing ways to reproduce the problem, it's possible that there is interference corrupting the communications between your computer and the certified security adapter. A dead parabolic antenna on top of your satellite dish could also be causing a similar issue. Consider unplugging your satellite dish and replacing it with a wired connection in order to rule out those possible causes. If that doesn't solve the issue, it might be time to contact your cable provider and ask them to check for any potential interference before you connect your computer to the network.

Problem

How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Alessandro Walsh.

Symptoms

Steps I've Taken
- Went into Settings and clicked the App Behaviour tab
- Checked the "DisableBackgroundAppOps" check box and changed it back to its original setting
- Restarted the computer in case there was a residual effect from the last change
- Attempted to open the BlueChart maps program and received an error message that it had to be closed down because it was interfering with Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite

Comment

1. Initially, the user attempted to open the BlueChart maps program and received an error message indicating that it was interfering with Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. This indicates that there may be a residual effect from disabling background app ops on the troublesome program.
2. The user may have tried to restart the computer as a last resort in order to cleanse any remaining traces of the app interference.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: connecting to sonar is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Alex Odom.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to sonar is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Alex Odom.

Symptoms

The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is shutting down when trying to connect to sonar.

The problem appears to be with the XML file that controls the connection between sonar and the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. The file is missing some required structures, and as a result, CommunicationManager cannot communicate with SONAR.

There are several potential solutions to this problem. One is to correct the missing structures in the XML file, and another is to create a related configuration file (if one does not already exist) that contains the necessary information.

Comment

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the real time tracker is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Alexander Liu.

Symptoms

My Mercury fails to power on in cold weather resulting in freezing of the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suiteapplication.

Comment

1. Check to see if your battery is fully charged
2. Make sure that the Mercury and the Guidare boat navigation software suite are properly plugged into an electrical outlet
3. Check to see if the Mercury has power using a voltmeter. If it does not have power, then you will need to replace the Mercury's battery.
4. Make sure that all cables connecting the Mercury and the Guidare boat navigation software suite are firmly connected
5. Try to restart the Mercury several times in order towarm it up or change its settings

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: activating the vessel identification is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Alexandra Li.

Symptoms

I am having problems activating my vessel identification on my Mercury operation. Every time I try to do it, the Guidance Boat Navigation Software Suite application freezes and I have to force quit it. I have tried going to the support website, but it says my unit is not registered or eligible for support. What can I do?

Comment

There could be several reasons why activating your vessel identification on Mercury is proving to be a difficult task. It is possible that you are missing the required software or hardware components, or that you are experiencing some space-related compatibility issues. If you have already attempted to activate your ID but failed, it may be helpful to troubleshoot your configuration by performing a raw file transfer from another machine without the benefit of Quest's application or customization tools. Once you have determined the source of the problem, please contact Quest Support for further assistance.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: changing the maps is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Alexandria Curtis.

Symptoms

I have a 1999 mercury cougar. The problem is the software that tells me how to get to places (guidare boussea navigation suite) keeps freezing up and I can't change the maps.

Comment

-First, ensure that you have the most up-to-date map version for your area. You can find this information on Mercury's website (www.mercury based.com), or by selecting "about Customer Services" when starting the car. The newest versions of maps should be available soon after they are released.

-Make sure that you are using the most recent softwareupdate for your car. You can do this by going to Menu - System Setup - Onboard Computer Updates. If you go Custom Maps, be sure to check "Update Automatically".

-If you experience map freezing, try quitting the Guided Tour computer program and restarting it. For best results, use a direct link from your desktop to the Mercury website when starting up Guided Tour: Go to www.mercurybased.com/gboussea select Guided Tour and click Open in New Window.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the autopilot is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Alexis Solomon.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the autopilot is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Alexis Solomon.

Symptoms

My Mercury V8 powered boat suffers from freezes and general software issues when I attempt to enable the autopilot. As a result, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application malfunctions and becomes almost unresponsive. The repairs required to prevent future problems seem overwhelming and require invasive procedures that could undo years of hard work.

Comment

The most common problems people experience with their electronic gear are freezing and general software issues. Symptoms can range from simply not being able to start the navigation software suite or changing vessel setting to outright system shutdowns or corruptions. Depending on the severity of the problem and the age of your electronics, fixing it might involve anything from addressing specific causes connected to freezing such as improper insulation levels or corrosion, to completely rebuilding and re-issuing critical electronics components. There's no one "right" answer to this situation as every boat is different and will require a tailored approach that considers the age, type and condition of your electronics. If you're experiencing any electrical issues on board, be sure to take quick notes on what occurred including when, where and how it occurred in order to help improve\ prevent future failures. Additionally, if you're considering any maintenance or repairs work done on your boat, do your homework first by speaking with a pro who specializes in fleet electronics\ boat repairs so you know exactly what needs to be done and safest procedures for minimizing potential damage.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Alfonso Henderson.

Symptoms

The Mercury Fishfinder application is freezing when I try to enable it.

Comment

The Mercury Fishfinder application may be frozen if you have overdue updates or if there are too many open applications using up memory. You can check for updates by going to the App Store and searching for "Mercury Fishfinder." If there are any updates available, you will be prompted to install them. If the problem persists, you may need to clear your RAM (memory) so that the Mercury Fishfinder application has room to run.

Symptoms

Hi Experts,

I have a Mercury 115 hydroplane that is working fine except for one problem. Connecting to the internal wifi is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Is there an easy fix for this? I'm sorry if this is a silly question. Thanks in advance!

Comment





The issue could be rooted in the device or software. If the issue is with the device, then you may need to uninstall and reinstall the fishfinder.tumblr.com driver.

If the issue is with the software, there is not an easy fix. Checking for updates and installing the newest versions of necessary software could fix the problem. However, if after following these steps the problem persists, then your computer may need to be serviced or replaced.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Erik Ali.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, the viewing of BlueChart maps is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. To fix the issue, please follow these steps: 1. Start by deleting all cached files for the application from your hard drive. This includes any cookies, temporary files, cache folders, orStatistics folders.
2. Restart your computer and try again to view BlueChart maps. If the problem persists, try updating your graphics card driver. 3. If neither of these solutions work, please open a support ticket with Guidare to see if they can help solve the issue.

Comment

Please check to see if all cached files for BlueChart were deleted from your hard drive. You may need to restart your computer or update your graphics card driver if the problem persists. If Guidare does not have a satisfactory solution, please open a support ticket.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to sonar is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Aliana Drake.

Symptoms

My Mercury is freezing up when I try to connect to the sonar. It's so frustrating because the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is an essential part of my boating experience!

Comment

It sounds like you may have a problem with your Mercury marine electronics. Whether it's your Sonar, Navigation system or Instrument panel, if you're having trouble connecting to them and keeping them powered up, there's a good chance that something is wrong. Very often the cause of this type of issue is simply a loose wire or bad connector - if you can isolate and correct the underlying problem, then your Mercury should start working again without any further troubleshooting.

We've got a problem with our Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application that is causing it to freeze up. We're not sure what to do to fix it!
Might you be able to help?

The issue seems to occur when we try to disable the 'Wind Capture' function. When we do this, the application freezes up and we have to hard-reboot the computer in order to get it back operational.

Can you tell us if disabling the 'Wind Capture' function will cause any other problems with the application? Is there anything else we can do to try and diagnose the issue?

Thank you for your time!

Alisha Stafford

Comment

Length:500

How do i fix: mapping a new route is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Aliyah Carson.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: mapping a new route is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Aliyah Carson.

Symptoms

My Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is freezing and I can't map new routes.

Comment

It sounds as though you may have experienced a software issue with your Guidare Boat Navigation Suite. If this is the case, we recommend troubleshooting steps specific to your machine before considering any other solutions. Below are some troubleshooting tips to try if your Guidare Boat Navigation Suite application is freezing or crashing:

Close all open applications on your computer and start your Guidare Boat Navigation Suite application.
follow the on-screen instructions to test the sound card and speakers
ensure that the CD drive is properly plugged in and functioning
ensure that your computer has good internet access and is set up to share files properly

Problem

How do i fix: connecting the sonar is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Allan Mcfarland.

Symptoms

My sonar is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

Hello,

There is a possibility that your sonar's calibration might not be foolproof enough for the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. If this problem persists, you might want to try resetting your sonar's settings and make sure that the connector between your sonar and mother board is securely plugged in. If you still experiences freezing issues, please let us know at service@guidareboats.com and we would be happy to assist you further. Thank you!

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Allie Villanueva.

Symptoms

When trying to connect to the internal wifi on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, the application Freeze's and I have to force close it.

Comment

There could be several reasons why your application may freeze while attempting to connect to the internal wifi. It is possible that your hardware or software is not compatible with the internal wifi, or there may be interference from another device near by. If you are unable to permanently fix the issue, you may need to uninstall and reinstall the application.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the wind capture function is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Alvaro Arroyo.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the wind capture function is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Alvaro Arroyo.

Symptoms

Whenever I disable the wind capture function, it seems to reset the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. How can I fix this?

Comment

There could be a simple explanation for this problem. When you disable the wind capture function, it might accidentally disable the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite as well. To fix this, you can try reversing the steps that you took to disable the wind capture function: first, make sure that the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is disabled; then, verify that the wind capture function is enabled.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: changing the maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Alyssa Truong.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: changing the maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Alyssa Truong.

Symptoms

Basically, what happens is that the computer system (the Mercury) swaps out the "Guidare" program for another one, whether or not you have asked it to. If you used the guidence features a lot, and you want to get them back, you need to go through these steps:

- Uninstall the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite from c:\program files (x86)\guidare
- The Guidare website has a FORMguide that tells you how to send in your registration Number for a new software suite upgrade and/or retrieve a copy of your old software
NOTE: Stating again, having the old software registered in progress won't help.

Comment

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: mapping a new route is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Amalia Valdez.

Symptoms

Hello!

I've been struggling for a few weeks now trying to figure out how to fix the problem of my Mercury's mapping a new route is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Everything seemed to work just fine until I needed to navigate to a different location; after selecting the destination and inputting the address, the application crashes, saying that it cannot find any navigation data. The only thing I can think of is that whenever I switch locations in the map, it somehow reset something within the Guidare software suite and touched off this string of odd events.

Has anyone else been experiencing this problem? Is there any way to prevent its occurrence? I really need to be able to use this application as it's extremely helpful while boating. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Comment

First, it's important to realize that you may be experiencing a problem with the Mercury software suite itself. Make sure to have all of your installation files (including Mercury Simulator) installed in order for the application to work correctly. If you still cannot fix the issue, please reach out to Mercury customer service for support.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:enabling the fishfinder
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application. Thanks, Aminah Bond.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Aminah Bond.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Aminah Bond.

Symptoms

I am having an issue with my Mercury On My Boat Fishfinder resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. I have had this problem for a few months now and I have tried everything to fix it. I believe it is something on my computer but I'm not sure how to fix it. Anyone have any advice?

Comment

It sounds like you might have a problem with your computer's connecting to the Mercury On My Boat Fishfinder. This could be caused by a number of things, but the most common is that there is a communication issue between the computer and the Fishfinder. You can try to re-establish communication by following these steps:

1. Check to make sure all cables are tightly connected between the Fishfinder and the computer.

2. Try restarting both devices.

3. Try adjusting any hardware settings on the Fishfinder or computer, such as turning off Apply updates Automatically on the Fishfinder and trying configuringing the computer to use direct fish finding mode.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Amiya Benton.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Amiya Benton.

Symptoms

I have a 2006 mercury montero limited and when I try to connect to the wifi it resets the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

According to Mercury factory manuals, when disconnecting the AUX input cable from the audio connection jack on the dash, it disables remote starting/pausing of the boat. You can either reconnect the AUX input while still connected to shorepower or remove and replug the AUX input.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Amiya Henson.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Amiya Henson.

Symptoms

I have a Mercury Monterey 2004 with Ford SYNC. The BlueChart Maps application resets the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite everytime I open it. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app, resetting the computer, clearing all caches and browsers, changing from manual to satellite navigation and back to manual again, resetting my network settings, and even reformatting my hard drive. None of it has worked. What can I do?

Comment

The most common reason one might be having difficulty with the BlueChart mapping application is that the map data for their area of the country has since been changed and the application needs to be updated in order to display this properly. Unfortunately, there does not seem to be a way around this task. The only solution appears to be for the individual to wait until the software updates are released and install them when they become available.

Symptoms

My Mercury WaveDriver guides boat' Ive had it for about year ,bought from a dealership . No problems until recently boat connected to sonar restarting my GUIDAR Boat Navigation Software suite application.

Comment

Started noticingpatterns on screen that didn't look right . Thought it might be something with the waves but decided to take it in for service .mercury told me they couldn't find anything wrong and that I needed to resync my wave device with my hardware because they were now using different frequencies.

Hello,

Thank you for considering a Mercury WaveDriver. We apologize if any issues have arisen with your device. If you would like to password protect your device, the Warranty Center can help do this for a nominal fee. I suggest speaking with your retailer about their warranty policies as well. Thank you for purchasing a Mercury product and have a great day.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: activating the vessel identification is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Anabelle Esquivel.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: activating the vessel identification is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Anabelle Esquivel.

Symptoms

When I try to activate the Vessel Identification (VID) in my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application, I am prompted to reset the application. Doing so reinstalls the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, but my vessel identification information is reset and cannot be used. Why would the activation of the VID reset the software?

Comment

In order for the Vessel Identification (VID) to be activated, it requires that your Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application be opened. If you attempt to activate the VID while the software application is closed, then the activation process will prompt you to reset the software. Resetting your software reinstalls it and reclaims all of your vessel identification information.

Comment

Problem

Symptoms

I have a new 27' soft-top fishing boat with a Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite (GNS) system. The sonar connects to the GNS, but every time I connect it, the GNS application resets. How can I fix this?

Comment

Your problem could be that your boat dock has a frequency range that the sonar is not compatible with. Make sure you are using the equipment that is recommended by Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite and check to see if your dock or sonar frequency range are listed as compatible.


If these solutions do not resolve your issue, try restarting both the GNS and sonar system.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite

Boat:Mercury

Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Chase Andrade.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Chase Andrade.

Symptoms

I am having difficulty connecting to the internal wifi on my laptop. Every time I try to connect, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is resetting.

Comment

There could be a few potential causes for this problem, some of which could be benign and others of which might require corrective action.

Certainly, one potential cause is if there is been a change in location of your router or the wireless signal within your home or office. Check the location of your router and possibly adjust the settings if necessary. If that doesn't help, you might need to purchase a new router. There also could be interference from other electronics in your home OR office. Try moving those away from your computer or bringing in an omni- directional antennas if that isn't effective. In addition, if you are using an older or slower laptop with a single network card, it might not be able to keep up with the two or more users on a wifi network and get bogged down trying to connect. Purchase a newer, faster laptop with multiple network cards and/or boost your internet connection speed.

If these measures don't remedy the issue, there could be a problem with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application itself. Make sure you have installed all of the latest updates for the software (available via downloads on our support site at http://www.guidareboatsolutions.com/support), as well as verifying that the videos and navigational data used in the software are legitimate and licensed for your use. Please also check whether Compatibility Mode (available by clicking "Compatibility Mode" on the left side of each video) is enabled on your computer. Turning Compatibility Mode off should return the application to its default settings and allow consistently connecting to internal wifi networks without resetting.

If these steps fail, it would be worth sending the software to us so that we can run exhaustive scans from our cloud-based scanners for viruses, spyware and other malicious softwareDPsychologist Brent OzburnCEO & Chief Psychologist, North American Society for Human Resource ManagementCTO & Chief Psychologist, BLEST HR Consultants

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to sonar is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Angel Newton.

Symptoms

I've been running the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite for a while now and everything was working perfectly until all of a sudden I started getting errors connecting to sonar. Now any time I try to connect I get this message: "The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application has had a problem and needs to be restarted." Surely something as crucial as ship navigation can't be that susceptible to needing an automatic restart, could it? If anybody can help me out there, that would be much appreciated.

Comment

This seems like a problem with your specific computer or settings - is there anything you've done that makes it difficult or impossible to connect to the Sonar service? It sounds like something might be blocking the program's access to the Sonar server, which could be due to a firewall rule preventing the software from connecting, problems connecting to the network itself, or older versions of Sonar that your computer can't support. In any case, it sounds like providing more information about your computer and network setup might help resolve the issue - are you using an official Guidare software serial number, for example?

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the real time tracker is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Angelica Mcbride.

Symptoms

I have a 2011 Mercury Marquis and when I try to start the Boat Navigation Software Suite to use it as my real time tracker, it fails to launch. What can I do to fix this problem?

Comment

1) Ensure that you have the latest version of the software suite installed.

2) Check for any obstructions or conflicrments that may be blocking the software from launching (for example: incorrect directories, outdated system files, etc.).

3) Make sure that you are using the most up-to-date version of the internet browser (typically this is the version that is included with your computer).

4) Verify that you have completed all required steps in the software installation guide.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the wind capture function is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Angelique King.

Symptoms

The wind capture function on my Mercury is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. To disable this, I went to its Boot section in the Startup manager and checked the "wind capture" option.

Comment

Your Mercury wind capture function is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. To disable this, you should go to its Boot section in the Startup manager and check the "wind capture" option.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: activating the vessel identification is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Aniya Solomon.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: activating the vessel identification is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Aniya Solomon.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, when I press the Activate Vessel Identification button on the control panel, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application starts. This is problem because I need to use the Activate Vessel Identification button to turn on my vessel identification lights, and I can't do that if the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is running.

Comment

This is a common problem. The Activate Vessel Identification button normally starts the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application, but if you keep it pressed while you are trying to turn on your vessel identification lights, it will also start the application's control panel. To avoid this problem, always try to start the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application first and then turn on your vessel identification lights.

On my Mercury, how do i fix: mapping a new route is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Anna Burnett.

Symptoms

I was driving my Mercury 6.2 DI this morning and decided to try and map a new route. I started the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application, but it would not load and just kept booting. Can someone tell me how to disable this behavior or fix it?

Comment

Since this application stores routing data in your Guidare Maps cloud account, you will need to either disable the application or delete the relevant data from your cloud account before using the application again.

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting the sonar is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Anna Davis.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting the sonar is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Anna Davis.

Symptoms

My car will not connect to my sonar. This happened right after my car got broken into. I tried following the instructions on how to connect the sonar and it just keeps loading the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

Believe it or not, there could be several reasons why your car will not connect to your sonar. If your sonar was connected before the car was broken into, the thief could have unplugged it. However, even if your sonar was working properly, there is a possible issue with the antenna. Sometimes when a car damages an antenna cable, it can cause the transmission to fail. If you follow the instructions for connecting the sonar and still no luck, please consult with a mechanic or an electronics specialist to try and troubleshoot the issue.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite

Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the autopilot is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Anna Davenport.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the autopilot is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Anna Davenport.

Symptoms

Hi everyone, I have a Mercury Montego that keeps disabling the autopilot when I boot the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. I've been trying to find a way to fix it but I can't seem to get anywhere. Does anyone know how I can disable the autopilot and then disable the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application in order to keep them from happening simultaneously? Thanks in advance!

Comment

Hello,

There could be a few reasons why the autopilot might be disabling in this scenario - most likely it is due to an interaction with another application such as the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. There are a few things that you can do in order to try and fix this problem:

- Disconnect any peripherals that may be interfering with communication between the Mercury Montego and the computer - this could include cell phone chargers, portable DVD players, etc.
- Make sure that all Windows updates have been installed and applied (this will provide updated drivers and software presets)
- Check to see if there is anything blocking the autopilot installation or activation - this could include incorrect hardware drivers, malicious software on the computer or other Mercury Montego components, or excessively large storage files on your drive.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Annabella Carr.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Annabella Carr.

Symptoms

The onboard computer screen will occasionally come on in Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite and Remain displaying the blue search cursor when attempting to begin a Map Pilot cruise (typically caused by incorrect power configuration). There are two solutions for this: 1) Restore computer back to factory default settings and create a startup disc with just Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite stored on it in order to build-in a workaround for your specific problem 2) Disable the fishfinder from appearing in the startup list.

Comment

1) Restore computer back to factory default settings. This will ensure that the onboard computer screen will not come on in Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite and remain displaying the blue search cursor when attempting to begin a Map Pilot cruise. To restore your computer to factory default settings, follow these steps: a.) On your computer, click on the "Start" button and select "Control Panel." b.) Under "Appearance and Personalization," select "Devices and Printers." c.) Double-click on the connected printer and select " configurations" from the drop-down menu. d.) Under "Printer Port Configurations," delete the second default port (usually "/PS2") and enter "[Port Name] : AC97" as the new default. e.) Click on OK. f.) Restart your computer. 2) Disable the fishfinder from appearing in the startup list. This will make it so that the onboard computer screen will not come on in Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite and remain displaying the blue search cursor when attempting to begin a Map Pilot cruise. To disable the fishfinder from appearing in the startup list, follow these instructions: a.) On your computer, click on the "Start" button and select "Computer." b.) Under "Local Files," select "Preferences." c.) under "Users", select "Your User Name" and enter "{User Name}" as the password. d.) Select "Security Options" from the left-hand menu. e.) Underneath "Startup Items", be sure that "Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite" is un checked and click on OK.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Annalee Hoover.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Annalee Hoover.

Symptoms

My Mercury heats up so bad whenever I try to view the BlueChart maps. It's as if it's constantly searching for some nonexistent Bluetooth connection. Plus, even if I can see the BlueChart maps, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application always pops up and takes over my computer. How do I fix this?

Comment

Ben,

The Mercury heating problem could be caused by a number of factors including low battery power, poor internet connectivity, or an antivirus software program interfering with the Mercury software. Some users have also reported that turning off their anti-virus software resolves the heating issue.

To troubleshoot the Mercury heating problem, try verifying your computer's internet connection by using a speed test tool. If you continue to experience problems viewing the BlueChart maps, disable your antivirus program and see if that fixes the problem. Additionally, some users have had success resolving their mapping issues by disabling their Mercury software and installing the old BlueChart maps offline in a separate location on their computer system.

Symptoms

The drive or memory within the Mercury laptop that stores the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is failing and will not allow the application to be booted. To fix this issue, I must remove the broken drive or memory from the Mercury laptop and replace it with a working one.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: disable the wind capture function is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Annika Beil.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: disable the wind capture function is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Annika Beil.

Symptoms

Symptoms:


When I try to turn on the wind capture function in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, it doesn't work.

Much of the time, when I try to go sailing, the wind won't pick up until after about 5 minutes of trying. And then it will take awhile for it to seem to consistently gather speed and even last for more than a minute at a time. Quite frustrating!
So my question is how can I disable the wind capture function so that it will boot up correctly?

Comment

\


The wind capture function is alows you to collect wind speed information from the environment and use that data to help improve your sailing experience. It is possible that the function may be disabled inadvertently. You could try restoring the software to its latest version and then trying the wind capture function again. If the problem persists, you might need to contact your system administrator for further assistance.

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: mapping a new route is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Anton Griffith.

Symptoms

Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is unable to connect to the Cloud for mapping purposes.

Comment

There could be several reasons why Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is unable to connect to the Cloud for mapping purposes. One possibility is that the connection between Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite and the Cloud is not properly established. In order to fix this issue, you may need to reboot your computer or device, check your network settings, and test the connection again. Another possibility is that your internet connection might not be strong enough in order to support a map download. If you are having difficulty connecting to the Cloud, please try using a cell phone or other wi-fi connection instead.

Symptoms

-Make sure Sonar App is up to date - Visit The Official Guidare Boat Navigation Software Site and Update the software with the latest Version.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:enabling the autopilot
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application. Regards, April Casey.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: enabling the autopilot is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, April Casey.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enabling the autopilot is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, April Casey.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enabling the autopilot is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, April Casey.

Symptoms

Typically when someone installs the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, they are expecting it to work and enable the autopilot. However, some users are experiencing problems after installing the software. This problem typically occurs because the installer failed to enable in-application silencing for the autopilot. Without this protection in place, the autopilot will start up periodically (depending on how often it is active) and flood the user's computer with noise. In many cases, fixing this problem requires disabling the autopilot entirely and then reinstalling the navigation software.

Comment

Thank you for bringing this potential problem to our attention. We apologize for any inconvenience that may be caused by this issue and are currently looking into a possible solution. In the meantime, if you experience repeated occurrences of the autopilot starting up automatically, we recommend installing the software with in-application silencing enabled so that the noise it produce is not so harmful.

Symptoms

When I try to enable the fishfinder on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application, it always boots the application, but never enables the fishfinder.

Comment

One possible issue could be that you are trying to enable the fishfinder within an invalid application context. For example, if you were trying to enable the fishfinder within a popup dialog box, the fishfinder would not work. In order to enable the fishfinder, you must first open the main application window and then click on the Fishfinder icon.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Arely Molina.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Arely Molina.

Symptoms

I'm struggling to view the BlueChart maps. Whenever I try to open it, the boat navigation software suite application starts up. Can you help me?

Comment

I'm sorry to hear that you're struggling to view BlueChart maps. It sounds like there might be a problem with the software suite application starting up. Please try following these steps to troubleshoot the issue:

- Verify that all of your hardware and software are compatible with BlueChart Maps by downloading and installing the software.
- Make sure that you have an active internet connection, and that your computer is able to display graphics smoothly.
- Try Relocating the BlueChart Maps Icon: Select Start->All Programs->OziExplorer Menu Bar->Options and select Navigation Tools->Found Folders tab, then check whether the folder %appdata%\Ozi\BlueChartMapping has a Vaal Llama folder alongside it. If not, create a new Vaal Llama folder and rename the existing Vaal Llama folder to it (Vaal Llama will be located inside), then click on Change Directory. Navigate to the %appdata%\Ozi\BlueChartMapping folder and double-click on the Vaal Llama icon to open the application.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: mapping a new route is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Arian Thornton.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: mapping a new route is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Arian Thornton.

Symptoms

I have a Mercury Sable 2008 and the mapping a new route is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. It worked fine before I changed the route.

Comment

The possible causes of this problem could be a number of things including internal hardware corruption, incorrect GPS data or Settings, or simply a faulty route. If you have receipts for any trips taken before the change and recent GPS data, we may be able to manually update the Mercury Sable's software using those files. However, if none of these remedies work, it might be best to contact the manufacturer for replacement of the software or installation on a new device.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting the sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Ariana Cisneros.

Symptoms

Comment

There is probably something wrong with your Mercury interface, as connecting it to the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application generally results in an error message. Try connecting your Mercury using a different USB port on your computer, or see if you can troubleshoot and fix the Mercury interface issue.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:enabling the fishfinder
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application. Thanks, Ariya Shaffer.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Ariya Shaffer.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Ariya Shaffer.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Ariya Shaffer.

Symptoms

My Mercury will not let me activate the Fishfinder feature. It says "Enabling the Fishfinder is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application." I have attempted to do it multiple times, but always get the same error message. What can I do to fix this?

Comment

There could be a couple different reasons behind why your Mercury Marine Fishfinder may not be working properly. The first, and most common is that you may have turned off the Fishfinder function in your boat's navigation system. To enable the Fishfinder, go into the menus on your boating system and select "Function Options." Select "Fishfinder" and make sure that it is switched to "On." If it is not already on, you will likely need to toggle it on before you can use it.
There could also be an issue with your Mercury Marine Fishfinder's software. Go ahead and try activating the Fishfinder again, but this time first make sure that your Mercury Genuine Instrument Warranty (GID) sticker is still in place. If you do not have a GID sticker, then go ahead and contact your local Mercury Dealer or Authorized Service Center for assistance.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:connecting to the internal wifi
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application. Thanks, Armando Wiley.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Armando Wiley.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Armando Wiley.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Armando Wiley.

Symptoms

I recently have had trouble connecting to the Mercury's internal wifi. Every time I try to connect, I get an error message in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. I've tried resetting my router, checking the network settings, and even un syncing my Mercury's Google account. Any ideas on how to fix this?

Comment

There could be a few things that are causing your issue. One possibility is that the Mercury's wifi network address is unknown or has changed since you last connected. You can try to connect to the wifi network using the Mercury's network settings and then contacting nearby mobile networks to see if they have an unobstrusive network near by. In addition, it is possible that the Mercury's Google account has been deactivated or deleted, in which case you will need to reactivate it or create a new one. Finally, sometimes routers incompatible with some wifi networks can cause connectivity issues. In this instance, it might be worth trying a different router before resorting to resetting your Mercury's router.

If that fails, you may need to perform a virus scan on your computer in order to remove any potential viruses that may be interfering with the proper function of BlueChart. Thank you for using our support forum and we hope to have found a resolution for your issue soon.

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Thanks, Arturo Pope.

Symptoms

I am having trouble connecting to my sonar unit on my mercury. It says that the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is unable to connect. I have tried changing the port in the application, but it doesn't seem to work. Do you know what could be causing this problem and how I can fix it?

Comment

There could be several reasons why your sonar connection may not be working. Firstly, you might need to make sure that the port number in the application is correct. Secondly, you may need to restart your computer system or the guidance software suite. If neither of these tips work, please email help4mercury@guiademarineracing.com for further instruction.

Symptoms

Hello!

Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: mapping a new route is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Micah Ashley.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: mapping a new route is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Micah Ashley.

Symptoms

Boat navigation software suite is crashing and locking up right when I try to map a new route.

Comment

The software suite might be crashing or locking up right when you try to map a new route. This could be due to a number of reasons, including residual effects of a recent system update, incompatibility with your device and computer, or insufficientitime backup copies.

To troubleshoot this issue, try restarting the software suite, uninstalling and reinstalling it, checking the software's compatibility with your device and computer, and verifying that there are requisite backups for it. If these solutions fail to resolve the issue, you might need to contact the software's manufacturer for assistance.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enabling the autopilot is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Ashlyn Walls.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enabling the autopilot is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Ashlyn Walls.

Symptoms

The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is not allowing users to enable the autopilot. The error message stating "'enable_autopilot' cannot be set because Package B13878936
has register-time dependency on 'enable_auto_pilot'" is appearing.

Comment

There can be a few causes of this problem. Sometimes the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application has been installed in a location where Windows is unable to obtain necessary files or registry keys. This can occur if the software suite has been installed on a new hard drive, or if the hardware on the computer has changed since the software was installed. Another possibility is that the software's dependencies have not been properly installed. Check to see if any of the following are true: The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite dependencies are listed in app-info.xml file
A copy of Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite app-info.xml file is located in c:\ProgramData\Guidare\BoatInfo
The system path to the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite app-info.xml file is correct
Inside of c:\ProgramData\Guidare\ folder there is an app-info folder with an appinfo.xml file inside
All program executables are located in c:\Program Files (x86)\GVidia Corporation If any of these are not true, then it might be necessary to upgrade the software suite and install its dependencies again.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Astrid Hunt.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Astrid Hunt.

Symptoms

Driver installation issues could be the root cause for this error. After the installation is done, it's important to make sure the driver is up to date. Guidare Boat Navigation Suite comes with the Windows Driver Package and updater that is installed on the PC. The updater checks for and downloads the latest driver packages automatically. If there are any updates available, it downloads and installs them. If there are no updates available, then the updater lets you know.abling HP CAPF support in Guidare Boat Navigation Suite This symptom could also potentially be caused by a network issue between your computer and Guidare Boat Navigation Suite. In order to troubleshoot this issue, please perform the following:  Verify that the Guidare Boat Navigation Suite application is properly signed in (see How to verify that a computer is properly signed in?).  Verify that your connections to other devices are not causing interference or blocking access to Guidare Boat Navigation Suite  If necessary, try connecting wirelessly

Comment

or using a different supported network connection.  If you are still experiencing problems, please contact your IT staff for further assistance.

To ensure the best possible performance and functionality of the Guidare Boat Navigation Suite, it is important to have up-to-date drivers installed. The Windows Driver Package and updater automatically installs any updates as they become available, while also letting you know if there are no updates available.
