createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:connecting to sonar
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application. Regards, Devin Atkins.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: connecting to sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Devin Atkins.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: connecting to sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Devin Atkins.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Regards, Devin Atkins.

Symptoms

The user is having trouble connecting to the Sonar application. Every time they try to connect, it says that their connection is erroring.

Comment

Issue source: The client computer

There could be many reasons why the user is having trouble connecting to the Sonar application. It is important to first troubleshoot the issue on the client computer, and then consider other possible causes if the problem remains unsolved.

Perhaps the user's computer is not connected to the internet. Check to see if the computer is plugged in and has an active internet connection. If not, try turning on automatic internet settings or connecting to a different network.

Another possible cause of the user's trouble connecting to Sonar could be an issues with the Sonar application itself. Try uninstalling and reinstalling Sonar, and make sure that all licensing information is correctly entered. Try opening Sonar from a different location on your computer, installing it on a different drive, and attempting to connect again.

If these steps cannot resolve the issue, it might be necessary to contact Sonar support for further assistance.

I need a fix for the device is stuck on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for the device is stuck on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

When I try to access the device "Device is stuck on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite." it just keeps restarting.

Comment

Are you using the original CD or DVD? If you are using the original CD, try unplugging and replugging your computer's power cord. If that doesn't work, try installing the software on a different device.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for i have a blank screen on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for i have a blank screen on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

I am having a blank screen on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. I have tried restarting my computer and adjusting the settings, but nothing seems to work.

Comment

There may be something blocking your computer's ability to access the Guidare software suite. You could try unplugging your boat's power cord for a few minutes and plugging it back in. Or, you can try resetting your computer's settings by following these steps:

- Click Start and go to Settings
- Click on Control Panel and then click on System Protection
- On the toolbar that appears, click on Reset System Settings
- A dialog will appear with four choices. Choose Check System Files and click on Next.
- Verify the information in the Files To Be Checked section, click on Next, and then click on Finish.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for there is a blinking red led on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for there is a blinking red led on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

I have a Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite and when I turn it on there is a blinking red LED. It is not making any noise and it is driving me crazy! Can you please help me fix this?

Comment

A blinking red LED is Not Normal. The blinking indicates that there is some sort of minor problem with the hardware or software. In your case, it may be a hardware issue such as a bad power cable or malfunctioning microchip. If the blinking persists even after you tried repairing the issue, then it is likely a software issue. So your best solution would be to contact Guidare support for assistance in diagnosing and fixing the problem.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for the progress bar keeps spinning on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for the progress bar keeps spinning on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

I have been using the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite for quite some time now and have never had a problem with it. However, lately I have noticed that the progress bar for my progress updates keeps spinning. It seems like every time I click on it, the progress bar goes around and around. This is incredibly distracting andmnbsiickj; it makes it difficult to track my current progress.

Ive tried resetting my preferences, uninstalling and reinstalling the software, performing basic troubleshooting steps described online, and nothing has worked so far. Is there something I can do to fix this issue? If so, please let me know!

Comment

There could be several reasons why the progress bar is spinning. One possibility is that your browser is blocking the Div authoring tool, which is needed to generate the progress bar. You can try disabling your browser's pop-up blocker and/or uabling Adobe Flash Player for a more comprehensive experience. You can also try reloading the page or clearing your cache and cookies. If none of these work, please let us know at support@guidare.com and we'll investigate.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for the map is not being displayed on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for the map is not being displayed on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

I have a Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite and I cannot see the map.

Comment

Hello, Thank you for reaching out regarding your Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. While we cannot help with the technical aspects of using the software, we can provide you with a list of resources that may assist in troubleshooting your issue.



If you are experiencing difficulty seeing the map, it may be helpful to207 check that your computer has the latest driver updates installed. If you use an external hard drive for navigation, make sure it is formatted as GPT and has a partition set up specifically for Guidare. If you have tried all these solutions and still cannot see the map, please send us an e-mail at support@guidareboatsolutions.com and we will do our best to help you diagnose the problem.

Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for cannot connect to Panoptix device on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for cannot connect to Panoptix device on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

I am using the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite and when I try to connect to my Panoptix device it says that I am not authorized to use it. If I log into my account it will let me connected, but then when I try to view a map or Routes it says that I am not authorized.

Comment

The problem could be due to the fact that the. Panoptix device and software are not registered on the same computer. To register, you can: 1) Activate your Panoptix device using the activation code that came with it, or
2) Go to our online registration form to create an account and use your email address and activation code to login.

Hello, I'm having problems connecting to my built-in wifi on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Everywhere else in the house (on other devices) seems to be fine. The software suggests that there is a network issue, but I can't find anything that needs fixing on my end. Any ideas?

Comment

I am experiencing the same issue! I recently bought a new router and updated the software, but it has not helped. When installing the app on my other devices, it finds the wifi signal and connects without any problems. However, on my boat, when I try to connect, the prompt says "There is a network issue." I've tried different avenues including checking for obstructions in the wi-fi signals and updating my apps, but nothing seems to be working.

Temp:1.2

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the device is stuck.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the device is stuck.

Symptoms

I have a mercury marine outboard that I use the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on. Recently I found that it would will not move no matter how much I try, even putting in full power. I went to the Guidare website and did a trouble shooting and determined that my battery was dead. After purchasing a new battery, the device still won't work. Now I'm thinking this might be a software issue. Can you help me?

Comment

There could be a number of reasons why your Mercury marine outboard will not move. First, it's possible that the battery could be dead. If you've recently replaced the battery, make sure to charge it prior to usage so that it's fully operational. Additionally, ensure that each switch and connector on your outboard is properly seated and connected. Finally, if there is something stuck in the gears, a manual override may be necessary in order to free the obstruction. If none of these solutions work and you are certain that the battery is fully charged and all connections are properly made, then it may be necessary to take your outboard repairman into account for more serious diagnoses.

Rest assured, if you continue experiencing difficulty following these instructions, please contact our technical support team at technopreneur@guidea.com so they can help troubleshoot the issue. Thank you for your patience and understanding!

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, there is no connection to the sensors.

Symptoms

Hello. my husband and i purchased the guidare boat navigation software suite to use on our mercury Marine engine V8. The software worked the first time we tried connecting the device, however, after 2 tries now there is no connection between the sensor and the software. could this be a hardware problem on my husband's side??


Thank you for your query! You should try FCC ID: ****** , under Accessories tab on Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite main screen, in case you have any issue with hardware connectivity.


If you still have difficulties, you can try PMAE142 hack that could make some Mirrors scan other sources than navigaterf because when their in that position many times other frequencies are reflected back and mess with frequency readings-PMAE has instructions for doing it if needed. If that doesnt work then I would recommend unplugging the device for 10 minutes once connected and plugging it back in to see if its any better

Comment

.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for i have a blank screen on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for i have a blank screen on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

I have a blank screen on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. I was using it to view a route and it just went blank. I think there might be something wrong with the software, but I'm not sure what.

Comment

The CS401 software has a lot of features and is very user-friendly. Occasionally, something might go wrong and the screen will go blank. Some simple troubleshooting steps may help resolve the issue. First, make sure that all of your cables and cords are properly plugged into the computer and the docking station. Next, try restarting your computer and/or docking station. Finally, check that the software is functioning properly by using one of the pre-existing routes.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for there is a blinking red led on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

I have had trouble tracking my boat for over a year now. The red blinking light on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite has been driving me crazy. It's been very difficult to orient myself and find my way home. The blinking red light really stresses me out. I'm really hoping someone can help me out with this problem.

Comment

Although I have found it difficult to orient myself and find my way home, patience is a virtue. Perhaps instituting regular practice at finding your bearings (perhaps attaching a chart to your boat itself) will give you an edge once you get used to the system. Finally, be sure to keep an updated version of the software suite, so that you always have access to boat navigation resources while out on the water.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite

Title Sentence:I need a fix for [KEYWORD] on my [PRODUCT].

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for the progress bar keeps spinning on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for the progress bar keeps spinning on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite includes a progress bar that periodically occurs to show the user how much progress has been made completing a task. The progress bar generally works fine, but on certain occasions it will start spinning erratically, making it difficult for the user to track their progress. This problem would greatly frustrate users who are trying to complete a task and must constantly search for the correct location on the screen in order to keep track of their progress.

Comment

One possible solution for this problem could be to add a button that dismisses the progress bar, or allows the user to cancel its appearance altogether. Another solution could be to make it moreclear when the progressbar is going to start spinning and how long it will last.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for the map is not being displayed on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

Hello Guidare,

I'm having problems with my map not displaying on my software suite. I've tried unloading and reloading the software, but it still does not show the map. Can you help me? Thanks!

Comment

Hi there,

It sounds as though your map may be missing or unsupported. Please let me know if you need any help getting in touch with the developer of the software suite in question to see if they can help support it and update it to include the map.

Otherwise, check to make sure that your computer is up-to-date with the latest drivers for your mapping software suite and any software installed on your device. Sometimes outdated drivers can affect compatibility with specific mapping features.

Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: I need a fix for there is no connection to the sensors on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Thanks, Abram Mckee.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for there is no connection to the sensors on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for there is no connection to the sensors on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite has stopped connecting to the sensors on my boat. This causes the software to crash frequently and consequently, I am unable to use it.

Comment

The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite needs to be connected to your boat's sensors for it to work properly. If the software isn't connecting to your sensors, it likely means that there is a problem with either the sensors or the connections between them and the software. It is possible that there is something blocking the sensor's signal, or that the connection between the software and the sensors is damaged. If you are still experiencing problems with the software, you may want to consider contacting Guidare customer service for help getting your boat navigation system working properly.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:cannot connect to Panoptix device
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:I need a fix for [KEYWORD] on my [PRODUCT].
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: I need a fix for cannot connect to Panoptix device on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Thanks, Abril Herrera.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for cannot connect to Panoptix device on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for cannot connect to Panoptix device on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

I need a fix for the Panoptix device on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Every time I open the software, I get a message that says "Cannot connect to Panoptix device." I've tried different ports, restarting my computer, and even uninstalling and reinstalling the software, but nothing seems to work. If there's anything else I can do to try and fix the issue, please let me know. Thanks, Abril Herrera.

Comment

If you're having trouble connecting to your Panoptix device, it might be useful to check whether the software is assigned a unique IP address. You can do this by opening Control Panel > Network and Sharing Center and clicking on "View network connections." Under "Local area connection," right-click on your Panoptix device name and select "Properties." In the item labelled "IP addressing," make sure that the "Subnetmask" box is set to netmask Default (255.255.0.0), and the "Gateway" box is set to the appropriate IP address of your computer ( usually an odd number ).

Problem

I need a fix for cannot connect to built in wifi on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

I am having trouble connecting to the built in wifi on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. I've checked all of the settings and the connection seems to work fine, but every time I try to connect I get a message that says "cannot connect to built in wifi." I've tried different networks and even using a different router, but nothing seems to work. What can I do to fix this problem?

Comment

It sounds like there might be some issue with your wifi connectivity. Try troubleshooting the issue by opening the Guide Boat Navigation software and looking at the network settings. If you're unable to connect to the wifi network, it might be worth checking to make sure that the router you're using is compatible with the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite. Additionally, you can try contacting your cable or internet service provider for guidance on extending your wifi range.

If that does not work, you might need to get a new navigation device. Hope this helped!

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, there is a blinking red led.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, there is a blinking red led.

Symptoms

You are experiencing an issue with your Mercury boat navigation software, Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. You are reporting that when you use the software, there is a blinking red led on your screen. Please see below for a detailed problem description and solution.



When using the software on your Mercury boat, you may notice that the screen has a blinking red led- this is due to an issue with the software. The blinking red led indicates that there is some sort of error or malfunction with the software. The most common cause of this issue is usually a broken cable connection between the computer and the boat’s motherboard. To fix this issue, you will need to replace the detached cable with a new one. With that fixed, the blinking red LED should go away and the software will function normally. If not, please contact our customer service team for further assistance.

Comment

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the progress bar keeps spinning.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the progress bar keeps spinning.

Symptoms

I am having a problem with the progress bar in Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. The progress bar keeps spinning and I can't figure out why.

Comment

There may be a problem with your computer's operating system or Marshal� Rights. Please try the following:

1) Restart your computer.
2) Choose Start > Settings > Control Panel > System and Security > Regional and Language Options. Click on the Languages tab and make sure that the language for " boat nav software suite" is set to US English.
3) Close Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Then open it again and try using it.


The progress bar in Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite updates every few seconds in response to your movement on the screen. If you find it difficult to comprehend what is happening, then there may be a problem with your computer's operating system or Communication Mack� Rights. Contact us for more help.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite

Boat:Mercury

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the map is not being displayed.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the map is not being displayed.

Symptoms

I have a 1995 Mercury Marine OutBOARD Sport 50 which was originally powered by a V-8 engine. I just installed the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my computer and my Mercury says that the map is not being displayed. When I go to the map screen in the software, the cursor goes ahead but nothing comes up on the screen; I tried scrolling up and down, too. Did I do something wrong when I installed the software?

Comment

There could be several reasons why you're getting this error message. First, make sure that your computer is connected to the docked Mercury OutBOARD Sport 50 motorboat securely. If it's not secure, the computer may see the boat as a moveable obstruction and therefore block access to the map screen. Second, check that your installation of the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is up-to-date. Third, be sure that you are attempting to direct your OutBOARD Sport 50 using the software interface rather than controlling it manually with joystick/Joy Pad. In some cases, newer onboard electronics (such as those in some 2010–present OutBOARD Sports) may limit manual control of boating features to basic functions such as heading, speed, and proximity alarms setting.

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, cannot connect to Panoptix device.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, cannot connect to Panoptix device.

Symptoms

I am having issues connecting my panoptix device to the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. The software says that it can't find the device, but I'm confident that it is plugged in and turned on. Any help would be much appreciated.

Comment

This could mean a few things:

First, make sure the device is plugged into the computer and turned on. If you're using panoptix for the first time, you may need to install the software.

Second, make sure that you are using the latest version of Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. If you have not updated in a while, the download may be located on our website at:

https://www.guidareboats.com/products/boat-navigation/software-suites/panoptixupdates/.

Third, it may be helpful to try connecting your panoptix device directly to your computer via a USB cable. If that doesn't work, please get in touch with our customer service team at this link:

https://www.guidareboats.com/contact-us/. From there they can assist you in troubleshooting your issue.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, cannot connect to built in wifi.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, cannot connect to built in wifi.

Symptoms

I have the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite installed on my mercury boat and I cannot seem to connect to the wifi built into the boat. When I try to connect, I get an error message that says "The system could not establish a connection to the remote service."

Comment

There could be a number of possible causes for this problem, including but not limited to:

• The wifi network Augustus is connected to might be down or in use by another device.
• There might be blocking or interference between Augustus and the wifi network on your boat.
• A firewall might be blocking the connection between Augustus and the wifi network.
• The settings on your router or wireless plugin might need to be modified.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the wind capture function is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the wind capture function is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Hello and thank you for considering support for your Mercury souped-up boat!

I am experiencing an issue where the wind capture function is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. I have attempted to disable and re-enable the function but it does not resolve the issue. Could you please help me fix this?

All Mercury models from 2007 - Present feature an electronic wind gauge system within the in dash unit capable of calculating optimum speed and navigation destination on narrowboat or sailing craft routes in light winds, up to 10 mph. The system is activated by selecting "Enable Wind Capture" under "Tools"menu bar on moveable display screen inside the nav screen.
The wind measurement data is captured every second by Mercury Marine's expansive Global Positioning System/Inertial Navigation/Hit Map (GPS/IMU/HMI) tracking technology (embedded in Mercury 8 ball sensors rotating 12,000 times a minute), which continuously accumulates positional information relating wind speed, direction sampled hourly and Magnetic Variation reading measuring range variation from zero to 360 degrees around Greenwich Mean Time against datum on a 24 hr period. Actual Sail angle position readings are combined with Automatic direction calculation function and Maximum theoretical current into the efficient algorithm displaying both elapsed time and cruising speed of sailing vessel along chosen route solution on top Mercury 8-Ball holoflake Navigator graphic navigator with clearly corrected digital Nautical chart scale (1in 1knt). In critical case genuine intelligent automatic voyage planning guidance might become available across all areas at once aiding Cruising sailors willing to follow any type maps depicted like Coastal pilotage etc created with ®HM Michelin SOFTWARE* supported internet downloads library [HiWater GIS]**. Disclaimer: As your electronics contain moving parts approaching 17,500 Hz frequency applied on electronic circuits susceptible to Radio Frequency Interference noise† && during periods when navigation has been disabled for various reasons [wind gauge deactivation], spurious error signals might be produced which could disable Electronic Signal Processors operation inside your Amplifier Receiver& or unique characteristic interference amplifier circuitry tending initialize six buttons switches memory start position from " Autochart Disabled Mode " registered pressure readings got low warning indicator away during cruises until pressure reset back‡\.

Within about 90 minutes since activation sailing vessel under way will finally reach Marina exit having sailed 197NM approximate 219N Miles traveled dynamically onto true 4 digit Nautical mile destination reading obtained by GPS chipset seamlessly feeding your module's navigational

Comment

display* and electronic module electronically processing pressure, temperature or wind gages extensive sensors suite permitting smoothly controlled input to powerful D/A Converter§± selecting crisp Plasma Display Hi-Fi capable 16:9 aspect (not NTSC).[/BODY][/HTML]

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:changing the maps
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is shutting down the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix: changing the maps is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Kind regards, Agustin Foley.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: changing the maps is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: changing the maps is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, I was noticing that when I tried to change the default navigation map, it would shut down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. I followed the instructions online to change the map, but it did not seem to work. Can you help me troubleshoot this issue?

Comment

In order to change the default navigation map on your Mercury, first uninstall the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. From there, go to the "My Computer" icon in your desktop and open the folder where the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is installed. Find the configuration file (it will have a .gnd file extension) and open it with a text editor. Locate the lines that say "navigationMap1." Near the top of this file, update the value of "mapFile" to the name of the navigation map you want to use. Save the file and try reloading the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:mapping a new route
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is shutting down the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix: mapping a new route is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Kind regards, Brianna Ahmed.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: mapping a new route is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: mapping a new route is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I am having difficulty mapping a new route in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application on my Mercury. Every time I try to map a new route, the application shuts down randomly.

Comment

There could be a couple of things that are causing the application to crash, such as trying to map a new route when the device is drained of battery life, or if there is an error in the map. When you first install the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, you have to create and set up your account with their website. After you have created your account, you can then link it to your Mercury. Once you have linked it, make sure that your Mercury is connected to the internet. After you have linked it, open the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on your Mercury and select Routes from the Menu Bar on the left. If you haven't linked your account yet, than an introductory page will appear which will guide you through the linking process. Once your Mercury has been connected to the internet and the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is open, your progress will be saved each time you load it and resume a paused route.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting the sonar is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting the sonar is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Hello,

I have a 2007 Mercury mileage and it keeps shutting down the familiar Boat Navigation Software Suite program on my laptop computer when trying to connect wirelessly through the sonar system. I have tried different areas of the boat where the signal might be stronger and have even unplugged and replugged the relevant cords multiple times with no luck. I'm pretty certain this has something to do with the problem, but I'm unsure how to fix it. Can you please help?

Comment




The most likely cause of this problem is interference from other electronic devices, typically cordless telephones or CB radios, near the sonar system. To test for interference, try running the Boat Navigation Software Suite wirelessly from another computer located in a different part of the boat. If the problem persists, the source of the interference may need to be removed.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the autopilot is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the autopilot is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

"I'm having trouble enabling the autopilot on my Mercury. Every time I try, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application shuts down."

Comment

There could be a few things causing this problem:
-The autopilot on your Mercury may not be properly turned ON. You can check this by looking at the following caution message and confirming that the autopilot icon is light green (green means it's on, red means it's off): "Autopilot is off".
-To properly enable the autopilot on your Mercury, you will need to first go into advanced cruise mode and scroll to "Engage autopilot":
-If guided cruise settings are already set to OFF on your Mercury, you may need to reset them by going into "servicing" and navigating to "acoustic control settings".

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, when I enable the Fishfinder on theguiadare.com website, the Guida Boat Navigation Software Suite application shuts dowwn. Can you help me fix this please?

Comment

JS There might be several reasons why your Mercury Fishfinder might be causing trouble. It's possible that your computer system is unable to handle the extremely high demand ofaquarium tracking software at the same time. Additionally, fish finders often use complex electronics that are susceptible to cyber-attacks. To protect against these threats, it'simportant to make sure that your antivirus and firewall protection are up-to-date,along with regular system security checks. If those steps don't work, we suggest youcontact Mercury Customer Service for more help.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I am experiencing an issue with my mercury where if I try to view the BlueChart map cartridge, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application shuts down.

Comment

I am experiencing an issue with my mercury where if I try to view the BlueChart map cartridge, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application shuts down. We're sorry to hear that you're having trouble using your Mercury BlueChart map cartridge. Could you please tell us more about what steps you've taken to troubleshoot this issue? Here are a few things to check: -Have you tried uninstalling and reinstalling the BlueChart map cartridge? -Try different ways of opening the BlueChart map cartridge (from the Mercury CD or by plugging it into a computer) -Has the BlueChart map cartridge been updated recently? If not, please see our How to update BlueChart map cartridges guide for more tips. If you still have problems, please contact us for assistance.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to sonar is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The Mercury computer is shutting down the GUIDARE Boat Navigation software suite application.

Comment

Solution 1: Ensure that the Mercury computer is turned on. Restart the GUIDARE Boat Navigation software suite application if necessary.

Solution 2: Use Control Panel to determine whether a virus is affecting the GUIDARE Boat Navigation software suite application. If a virus is found, remove it using antivirus software.

Problem

How do i fix: enable the real time tracker is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Comment

Try talking to your IT department and requesting they help you optimize the software or add extra capacity to the server. Alternatively, if disabling some of the features within the software solves the issue, you could try doing that. Lastly, make sure you are properly following all instructions and tips provided by the software manufacturer.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: mapping a new route is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: mapping a new route is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I am having trouble linking a new route in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. When I link a new route, the navigation software starts to shut down, and eventually quits altogether.

Comment

One common error when linking a route in Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is that the software believes that the new route already exists. There are a few steps you can take to ensure this doesn't happen: first, make sure that your folders and paths are correct. Next, check that the software is actually searching for .gdb files when it tries to link a route. Finally, try linking a route once again, but this time click Add instead of Link.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: connecting the sonar is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting the sonar is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is shutting down when connected to the sonar.

Comment

There could be several reasons why the software is shutting down when connected to the sonar. One possibility is that there is an issue with the module or the cable connecting the software to the sonar. Another possibility is that the software is memory intensive and requires more resources to running than the computer can provide. If you are having difficulty connecting to the sonar, it may be helpful to try providing a different type of input, such as keyboard commands instead of using the mouse.

How do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I am having a problem with the fishfinder enabling - it is turning the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application off. Can you please help me fix this?

Comment

The problem could be one of several things. First, make sure the Fishfinder is activated - follow the instructions in the User's Guide. Second, check that your computer is connected to the internet and that the software is up-to-date. Third, make sure both the Fishfinder and Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite are running on your computer at the same time. Fourth, you may need to restart your computer.

Length:500

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Problem:

I am using the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite and my computer is connecting to the internal wifi, but the application is shutting down. Can you tell me how to fix it?

Comment

It seems like your computer is shutting down because the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is trying toconnect to the internet constantly. There are a few things you can do to fix this:1)Make sure that your computer has the latest Codecs and Updates installed.2)If you're using an older router, you might need to update it to support 802.11n.3)Check to make sure that the application is not restricting access to the internet. In Windows 7, click Start > Control Panel > Network and Internet > Connections. In Windows 8./10, tap or click the Network icon in the apps flyout menu and select Connections from the list on the left.

Where can I find more information about how to fix this issue?

There isn't really a definitive answer for this problem other than finding some guidethat describes how to optimize your operating system and hardware forbetter connectivity. However, if you need

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the wind capture function is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, the wind capture function is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

Dear Client,
On Samsung televisions with Mercury devices, if the TV freezing issue persists after following our instructions in our support article, turning off sweeping motions and using particular menu selection commands to prevent unintentional hand movements during TV set up that may cause the freezing issue. It appears that a firmware update from Samsung was released on Jan. 31st, which includes improved navigation performance. After you complete the firmware update and follow our instructions to turn off sweeping motions and use specific menu selections to prevent unintentional hand movements, see if the freezing issue goes away. If not, we recommend resetting your Mercury to factory defaults and then following the instructions in this Knowledge Base article: How to Reset a Mercury Televisions to Factory Defaults To minimize freezing issues on televisions equipped with Mercury devices, we recommend that you do one of the following: · Turn off sweeping motions by pressing the power button and turning it back on when prompted · Use specific menu selections to prevent unintentional hand movements during television set up Before making any hardware changes, please consult your TV documentation or ask your seller how to make these changes. In addition, if at all possible, attach a fan to an available outlet (not plugged into the TV) near where the Mercury is Participant Library Curriculum Planning Tips for Educators When monitoring price trends for certain object items students might need such as textbooks or lab materials, it would be helpful for educators to jot down 1) what those items cost before funds were cut
2) current prices for the same or comparable items after funds were restored
3) average resale prices over time should funds be trimmed again As an educator tracking price trends for budgetary Items: Before making any hardware changes concerning Items in student possession such as textbooks or laboratory supplies it would be helpful to SAVE THE ORIGINAL COST OF THESE ITEMS BEFORE THEIR FUNDING WAS CUT-
recording what those items cost BEFORE their funding was cut-
RECORDING CURRENT PRICES FOR THE SAME OR COMPARABLE ITEMS AFTER FUNDING WAS RESTORED-
AND AVOIDING AVERAGE RESALE PRICES OVER TIME - IF FUNDS WERE TRIMMED AGAIN

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: mapping a new route is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: mapping a new route is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I've been playing around with my Mercury Mullion for a little over a week now and I'm really enjoying it. However, there is one problem that I continue to run into and I can't seem to find an answer for it anywhere. Whenever I attempt to map a new route, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application (which is displayed on the map screen) seems to freeze up and I have to force it shut down by clicking on the 'X' in the top right hand corner of the window. Is there any way that I can fix this issue? Or is there a faster way to access the mapping software? Thank you for your time!

Comment

If the application is freezing up, it may be due to an old or outdated software installation, insufficient disk space, or virus protection. First, try to install the latest software updates for the application (usually found on Mercury MullionPackage CD-ROM or available from our customer service). If that does not resolve the issue, you may need to remove any unnecessary programs from your computer's memory (such as web browser histories and cookies) and free up storage on your computer.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:connecting the sonar
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is freezing the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting the sonar is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Kind regards, Alexis Robles.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting the sonar is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting the sonar is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, connecting the sonar is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

This does not seem to be an issue specific to Mercury; similar issues have been reported with other brands of sonars. If you have tried both Hondac 7.2 and Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite from the Windows Start Menu, "Programs" category, there may be a registry setting that needs to be tweaked . To tweak the registry setting: 1. Log in as an administrator by right clicking on the Start button and selecting "Run as Administrator ." 2. Type regedit and hit Enter. 3. In the Registry Editor window, under the "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE" key, click on "\Software\Hondac7189\NavServer" 4. On the "NavServer" tab, modify the "AutoOpenINPPath" value in bytes from 255 to 131. 5. Close Registry Editor, reboot your PC and try again to connect your sonar.

createCase

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the autopilot is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the autopilot is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Hi, I'm having problems with my Mercury hanging out of gear while in the ocean. The initiating cause is the autopilot clicking off on its own while sailing at a slow pace. After two tries of resetting the auto pilot (switching off the mercury) and disabling and re-enabling the Mercury various times, I had no luck regaining manual control of my boat -- any solution/input/advice much appreciated! Best, Alexis

Comment

The Mercury hanging out of gear problem could be caused by many things, but it is most likely the autopilot becoming disconnected. Sometimes when boats are travelling at a slow speed in the water, minor things like branches or rocks can get caught in between the gears and reel the engine off-line. If this has been happening often and your boat seems to be slipping even further out of gear,may be time for a mechanic to look at your engine and autopilot.

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The user is attempting to enable the fishfinder in the vehicle, but the Guidare Boat Navigation Software SuiteApplication is freezing.

Comment

DearCustomer,

Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. We are sorry to hear that the Guidare Boat Navigation Software SuiteApplication is freezing on your machine. From our research it seems that this might be caused by an optional software add-on,i.e. Fishfinder,that was recently installed on your system. We suggest that you try uninstalling the Fishfinder add on and trying again to enable the boat navigation software suite application. If that does not work then we suggest contacting the vendor of the Fishfinder add-on for assistance resolving this problem. Thank you for using Guidare Boating!

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I have a 2007 Mercury Marquis. Recently, my computer has been freezing when trying to connect to the internal wifi. It shares an SSID with another router in my house, but it still regularly freezes when I try to connect. The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application (which isnt the main reason I bought the computer) wont even start up unless I force shutdown and restart the computer. Ive tried different cables, different routers, and different laptops, but Everything still freezes when trying to connect. Can anyone offer me any advice on how to fix this?

Comment

First, it sounds like your computer is overheating. Overheating can cause a computer to freeze, especially if the heat is coming from one specific area of the machine. Try changing how you use your computer. If that doesn't work, be sure to consult with a specialist about your specific situation.

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the real time tracker is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I recently updated my update of Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite to the newest version but it is freezing up a lot. I've tried reinstalling the software, unplugging my USB drive and entire computer, flipping different switches in my computer, etc. Nothing has worked since the freezing began.

Comment

Hi there,

It sounds like you may have clogged up one of your software'resolution channels with temporary files or debris. Here are a few troubleshooting steps that may help:

1. Delete any temporary files thathave been created recently (especially thosethat are in your C: drive).
2. Check to make sure that your USB Drive is properly plugged into your computer and is not dead. 3. Disable anyarch antivirus programs or firewalls temporarily while you look into this issue. 4. Reboot your computer and then try the softwareonce again.
5. If none of these steps seem to rectify theproblem, please let us know and we'd be happy to help you out further!

Problem

How do i fix: disable the wind capture function is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

If the wind capture option is disabled, the application might freeze. To fix this, re-enable the wind capture function in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Comment

The problem could be that your computer's graphics card is not up to the task of displaying high-resolution map images. One solution is to upgrade your graphics card. Another solution could be to change to a different map set; for instance, replacing map set A with map set B.

Problem

How do i fix: connecting the sonar is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I am having trouble connecting my Sonar Elite depth finder to my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Every time I open the application, the Sonar Elite connection freezes and I need to force close the application. Can you help me fix this problem?

Comment

We are sorry to hear that you are experiencing connection issues with your Sonar Elite depth finder. Testing has shown that this issue is most likely due to incompatibility between the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite and Sonar Elite. We recommend that you update your Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application to the latest version. If you have verified that your Sonar Elite depth finder is up to date and there still seem to be connection problems, please contact our Customer Support team for assistance.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enabling the autopilot is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enabling the autopilot is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The autopilot appears to be freezing the System Under Test application when trying to enable it.

Comment

This could be caused by a couple of things: first, it could be that the System Under Test is not behaving as expected under autopilot, so the autopilot needs more data to sufficiently optimize. Alternatively, the autopilot may need a fresh instance of the System Under Test in order to " latch on " to it properly. Either way, we recommend trying booting off of an installation media and Startup Manager directly (as opposed to using deployment templates), as this is typically more reliable andraineous. If that still doesn't work, please send us more information on what is happening while trying to enable the autopilot, including FPS footage and application logs

Problem

How do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Screen shots taken while trying to enable the fishfinder froze the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

There could be a few reasons why screen shots taken while enabling the fishfinder may have frozen the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Some possible causes could include:

-The computer's hardware was not able to keep up with the new demands being placed on it and crashed.
-The user inadvertently clicked on a link that caused Jingbird to start loading and then crashed.
-Certain functions in theFishfinder cannot be executed from within quotation marks in Internet Explorer and caused interference with the software running on the computer.

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

When I attempt to connect to my school's internal wifi, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application becomes frozen and I am unable to work.

Comment

There might be a few things you can try to fix this issue. First, make sure that your computer is turned on and connected to the internet. If your computer is connected to the internet and you still experience difficulties connecting to your school's wifi, there could be a problem with your router. Try connecting to your school's wifi using a different device or checking for updates on your router. If all of these solutions fail to resolve the issue, apologize to whoever supervises the network and report the issue.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite

Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is freezing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

1. The “viewing the BlueChart maps” feature in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is freezing, preventing users from accessing or using the application.

2. This issue appears to occur when large files (like Google Earth imagery) areizzaed into the program.

3. It seems that deleting problematic files and rebuilding the map database resolves the issue for some users, while others may need to contact technical support to get help sorting out the issue.

Comment

1. Verify that your audio and graphics card drivers are up-to-date.
2. Try deleting any large files that you know are causing the issue, and then rebuilding the map database from scratch.
3. Contact technical support for help solving the problem.

In this case, you will need to take your computer to a specialist to check it out.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:enable the real time tracker
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the real time tracker is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Kind regards, Alora Palacios.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the real time tracker is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the real time tracker is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

One of my Mercury's features, the real time tracker, is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. I've tried different ways to fix this and none have worked. Sometimes when I turn off my car and then turn it back on, the real time tracker will start working again. But for the most part, it's resetting the software suite every time I turn my car off.

Comment

Your Mercury's real time tracker may be resetting your Mercury's Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. There are a number of steps you can take to troubleshoot this issue and hopefully solve it:

-Consider unplugging your Mercury's car battery for a few minutes before turning off your car to reset the real time tracker. This may only work if your Mercury's real time tracker is resetting the software suite on startup. If this doesn't resolve the issue, try holding down the power button for five seconds when you turn off your car.

-If neither of these tips resolve the issue, there may be a problem with your GUIDARE Boat Navigation Software Suite application installation or setup. If you're not sure how to install or set up the software suite, please contact your retailer or Mercury dealer for help.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the wind capture function is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

My Mercuryjet Cruises # 07489 is having issues with the wind capture function and resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

Hello 7489 user,

We are sorry to hear that you are experiencing issues with your Mercuryjet Cruises. Pressing the wind capture button may not be aligning the boat properly with the wind and resets the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. We recommend troubleshooting by checking to see if the module is properly plugged into the dock and powering on the system. If you still experience issues, please let us know and we can further troubleshoot the issue. Thank you for your cooperation.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: changing the maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: changing the maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

To fix the issue where changes to the map typically reset the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, try the following steps: 1. From the Start menu, select All Programs -> Mercury gulf release navigator -> Mercury Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.
2. Right-click on Mercury GWNS and click Properties.
3. In the General tab, verify that the Allow Startup (in Milliseconds) value is set to 10000ms.
4. Close Mercury GWNS and reinstall Mercury Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Comment

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: mapping a new route is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

My Mercury OnStar navigation system repeatedly chooses different routes when I try to set a destination, even when I'm driving in a familiar area. The maps and directions spontaneously change, apparently because the software mistook my old route for a current one. Each time the problem crops up, I have to erase the old route and relearn it from scratch. This wastes time I could be using more productively and annoys me because I can never be sure that the navigation will take me where I want to go.

Comment

1.talk to OnStar to see if there is anything they can do to help - they might be able to fix the software and/or improve their support staff.
2.get a navigation app that provides fuel efficiency data - this might help keep the car on the correct route more consistently.

First, could you please try disabling the autopilot in the software and re-enabling it? If that doesn't work, please let us know if you've tried resetting the software. If all else fails, we would recommend contacting Mercury customer service for assistance. Thank you for using our services!

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

iling the Mercury Fishfinder resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. In addition, the fishfinder is not turning on or producing a response when I press the power button.

Comment

iling the Mercury Fishfinder resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. In addition, the fishfinder is not turning on or producing a response when I press the power button.

One possibility is that the battery in your fishfinder is flat, and needs to be replaced. You can get a replacement battery from your local electronics store or online. Additionally, if the power button doesn't seem to be working, it could be that there is aproblem with the wiring near thebutton/switch. If this is the case, you may want to have a professional diagnose and repair the wiring issue.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Hello!

I have a 2002 Mercury Sable with the stereo wired in to an Aux input in the dash. I have attached a wire from the iPod to the Aux input and am using iTunes to sync it. Recently, I was Unable to connect to my internal wifi (something I've done before with no problem). Eventually, after seemingly tons of troubleshooting, I managed to figure out that restarting my car's computer solved the problem--connected immediately through the wifi network. However, about a week ago, connecting to the internal wifi started resetting my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application--as if shutting down and restarting my car caused the application not to cache properly and needed to be reloaded. I have checked everything--configuredAPnProperties ON kotaku.com/what-if-youre-locked-out-of-your-adw-applicaitions/36625401--fyi/, uninstalled AMZCOmbeddedondemand , rebooted....nothing has worked so far. Is there anything else I can try? ?

Comment

Help would be much appreciated!


Typically when trying to reset an APnP cache, you may need to perform a cold start of your device or shutdown/restart your device entirely. For more information on this issue, ensure you read the Collegiate Assistance Program article What if You're Locked Out of Your AdWords Applications at kotaku.com/what-if-youre-locked-out-of-your-adw-applicaitions/36625401?

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: connecting to sonar is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I have a Mercury Villager Hybrid 2006, and whenever I try and connect to sonar, the "Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite" app pops up and resets itself. This has been happening for a while, but I first noticed it when I was out sailing and the system kept resetting. I tried troubleshooting it by going into the settings for the Guidare app, but nothing seems to work. Can you help me resolve this issue?

Comment

Many drivers afflicted with this issue might uninstall and reinstall the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, updating drivers and consider other troubleshooting techniques without resolving the issue. Frequently users have reported that uninstalling and reinstalling the software has not worked. A user assistance specialist can more accurately diagnose and resolve the issue, as resetting of the product is caused by driver incompatibility, missed updates or malware. Appropriate interventions may require contacts with Guidare Ltd., service providers or antivirus software.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enable the real time tracker is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the real time tracker is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The real time tracker in the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite is resetting on occasion. To fix it, follow these steps: 1. Launch the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite.
2. Open the Station Options page.
3. Find the Real Time Tracker section and change theEnabled setting to Yes. 4. Save your changes.

Comment

When you're using the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite, it occasionally resets the real-time tracker. To fix it, follow these steps: 1. Launch the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite.
2. Open the Station Options page.
3. Find the Real Time Tracker section and change theEnabled setting to Yes. 4. Save your changes.

If both methods fail, we suggest that youcontact our customer service for assistance. Thank you for using Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

How do i fix: changing the maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: changing the maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I am having trouble with my Guidare boat navigation software suite. I changed the maps, and it is resetting the application. How do I fix this?

Comment

Your problem may be related to the way that your Guidare boat navigation software suite is loading its maps. Make sure that the maps are properly extracted, and that you are using the most up-to-date version of the maps. If you have altered or deleted any files in your Guidare boat navigation software suite's mapping folder, make sure to reformat this folder and re-install your Guidare boat navigation software suite.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: mapping a new route is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

When I update my smartphone's software and map a new route, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application gets reset. I cannot save my new route, or load it previously saved.

Comment

The software can reset if the following are true: a) you try to save your original route while the software is updating and it fails; or b) someone else tries to start using your saved route and it doesn't work.

Problem

How do i fix: connecting the sonar is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is resetting when connecting the sonar.

Comment

A resetting on the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite could be caused by a lack of power, an incompatible device connected to the software suite, a corrupted file, or something else. If the resetting continues even after troubleshooting steps are taken and the software is updated, it may be necessary to replace or Repair the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

We have a laptop that we use to access the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. We have been having trouble connecting to the internal wifi for months now. Whenever we try to connect, the software resets and we have to start over. Our IT person says that there is nothing that can be done to fix the issue. We've replaced our router, reinstalled the software, and tried different networks, but nothing has worked. What should we do?

Comment

It seems like your laptop is not recognizing the wifi network that Guidare is using, either because of a physical issue with your wifi router or a user issue with your laptop. There is not much that people can do to fix this other than await the IT department's suggestion that usually resolves such problems. Typically, you might need to reformat your laptop or update its firmware to get it working properly again with the Guidare software.

Problem

How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I have been experiencing an issue where the views for BlueChart maps reset every time I open the application. This results in losing all data loaded for devices associated with the application, and consequently necessitating reconstructing the devices from scratch.

Comment

There might be a problem with your surfing habits in relation to your BlueChart maps. Can you provide more information on what websites you’ve been visiting recently and how often? Have you open any images, drawings, or PowerPoint presentations while using the application? All of these activities could cause the map views to revert to their initial state.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite

Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the real time tracker is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: enable the real time tracker is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I have a 2007 Mercury Milan GT, and when I turn it on, the real time tracker application, Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, will not load. It just says "Waiting for system ready." Every time I try to restart the car or if I let the battery die, then turn it back on, the application will not load at all and I will have to start over from the beginning. This has been going on for a while and I've tried resetting the computer, factory settings, and everything. Any help would be much appreciated.

Comment

Hello,

Thank you for reaching out for assistance. It sounds as if you may have a software issue with Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. If you are able to login to the application and attempt to start a navigation course, it sounds as though your PC may be sending the correct signal to the application. It is possible that resetting the computer or factory settings may help fix the issue, but sometimes these things do not clear up an issue altogether. If remaining Unable to Start the Application persists, please consider reaching out to Guidare for more assistance; their support team can assist you in troubleshooting your specific software issue. We hope that you will find this answer helpful!

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the wind capture function is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: disable the wind capture function is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Earlier today when I tried to enable the wind Capture function on my mercury it would not let me. It booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite Application. I went into my Mercury User Controls and un-checked "Enable Wind Capture." Then I exited out of that application and re-booted my Mercury, however it has not yet worked. Can you help me fix this problem?

Comment

Most likely the issue is that you do not have the correct software installed on your Mercury to enable wind capture. The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite Application is necessary for this functionality. You should ensure that it is installed and active on your Mercury, and then re-check the "Enable Wind Capture" check box in User Controls after exiting the application. If all goes well, you should then restart your Mercury and test the wind capture functionality.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: changing the maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: changing the maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, when I try to change the maps it's booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

There could be a number of reasons why the Mercury is booting the Guidare boat navigation software suite application:

-One potential issue could be that the Guidare boat navigation software suite application has been configured as the default programme when Mercury begins to boot. If this is the case, you may need to contact your dealer to alter the configuration so that other applications can become the default.

-Another potential issue could be that there is a corrupt file located within the Guidare boat navigation software suite application. If this is the case, you may need to uninstall and reinstall the application in order for it to work properly again.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix: mapping a new route is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix: mapping a new route is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Hello there!

Thank you for contacting me. It sounds like you may be experiencing an issue with your GPS navigation system. Specifically, it seems as though when you try to re-map a new route, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application ( Birchwood Software Inc.) ==> is booting up.

If this is the case, there's likely a few things that you can do in order to try and resolve the issue. First, I recommend consulting your Owner's Manual or other documentation related to your GPS SYSTEM in order to ascertain how to reset or configure it. In some cases, this may involve plugging in power directly to the instrument using the supplied cord, while in others it may require using the software which comes preloaded on the system. In either event, I recommend trying each of these methods in turn until you lockout or otherwise correct the problem.

If resetting/configuring your GPS system doesn't workaround the issue, then I'll need more information from you in order to properly diagnose and potentially solve it. For instance: what specific software application are you using (i.e., Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite specifically), model and year of your Mercury vehicle, driver's identity (name and license plate number), etc...? Also please let me know if you've tried any alternate paths or routes recently - sometimes minor changes such as this can CAUSE issues on established routes later on. Thank you for your patience as we work to resolution this matter.

Comment
