createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:changing the maps
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix changing the maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix changing the maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix changing the maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

When I try to change the map, my Mercury resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite program.

Comment

There could be several reasons for this problem, but the most common one is that the map needs to be re-downloaded from the Mercury website. Try following these steps:

1. Open your browser and type "Mercury.com" into the address bar.

2. Once on the Mercury website, click on the "Maps & Navigation" tab at the top of the page.

3. On the left side of the page, under "Maps," click on "Loading Maps."

4. In the white space below "Loading Maps," you should see a green button with a QR code in it. Click on the button to access the Mercury website's app store (if you're not already there).

5. On the Mercury app store's home screen, tap on the "Mercury Maps & Navigation" icon (it looks like an orange hourglass), and then select "Map Updates."

6. In the pop-up window that appears, click on the "Install New Map" button next to "Phoenix Local Area Navigation." The map should start downloading immediately.

7. After a few minutes have passed, open your Mercury GPS again and try switching to the Phoenix Local Area Navigation mode. If you still have trouble, please contact helpdesk@mercuryintoindia.com

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:mapping a new route
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix mapping a new route is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix mapping a new route is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix mapping a new route is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Every time I try to map a new route, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application resets itself and I have to start over.

Comment

The issue you are experiencing could be due to a number of different factors. One possibility is that your computer has an issue with video card drivers or the operating system itself. If you are using a laptop, it may also be due to poor battery life and/or a low-quality screen. In addition, if you have multiple applications running at once, they may be causing interference and causing the issues. To help troubleshoot the issue, please do the following:

1. Close all other applications and browser tabs except for the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

2. Enable pop-ups blocker or allow limited pops-up windows.

3. Clean the hard drive by formatting it and deleting any unnecessary files or folders – this can help improve performance and ensure that there are no unnecessary leftover components interfering with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

If these steps don’t resolve the issue, please reach out to our technical support team for more assistance.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix connecting the sonar is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix connecting the sonar is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

How to reset the "Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite" application on a mercury: 1. Make sure you familarize yourself with Mercury's user guide.
2. Turn off the Mercury.
3. Remove the caddy assembly by disconnecting the electrical connector located beneath steering wheel and atop gas pedal.
4. Disconnect four stepper motor drive cables from levers that engage caddy's frontal suspension arms (1) shortly aft of front seat (2). There is a "9" folder in this removal step location: LHD
5. Examine cables for damage, if any. If none present, reattach each cable to its respective lever, noting where they were attached before removal. Levers will now be held stationary against frontal suspension arms by internal pressing action of spring(s), allowingstepper motors within caddy to provide motion in each angular direction (Yaw, Pitch, and Roll). If at any time during this procedure one of the steps proves difficult or dangerous due to irreparable cable damage or other issues, STOP immediately! See first comment under Notes following this article.........INVALID PROCEDURE NOTE STEPS 2-5 MAY BE PERFORMED ON MERCURY ALTERNATOR CORPS; SEE NOTES ABOVE ON 2006 MODEL YEAR VEHICLES MAKING REPAIRS TO RESTORE CABLE CONNECTIONS SHOULD AFTER SECURING LEVERS Drv/Spkr – 4 pin connectorStepper Motor Drives – 9 Pin connectorCaddy – Holder for Stepper Motors

Comment

,4 Shld Stepper MotorsMisc. – ABS ScrewsHi-Lift Connectors + Harness

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix enabling the autopilot is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix enabling the autopilot is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

A safety issue with the Mercury's boat navigation software suite is that it can be reset by enabling the autopilot. this can result in inaccurate sailing and could lead to a loss of mission critical data.

Comment

Mercury's boat navigation software suite is a critical system that enables safe sailing. The autopilot can be disabled, but should only be used for minor Navituion purposes and not for long periods of time as it can reset the software. This does not pose a safety risk as it would only disable a minor function in the software and there is no other way to lose mission critical data.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix enabling the fishfinder is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix enabling the fishfinder is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

One of the Modes in the Mercury Vessels Guidance Boat Navigation Software Suite (GNS) application has been resetting upon enabling - this is preventing the vessel from navigating.

Comment

It sounds as though one of Mercury's modes, located in GNS's application menu, might have been reset and is preventing the vessel from manoeuvring correctly. If this is the case, we recommend first disabling all other modes in order to identify which one might be causing the issue, and then restoring it if necessary. In the meantime, you can try temporarily strapping the vessel to a land-based helping hand in order to keep it moving in the right direction whilst you work on resolving the problem.

Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix viewing the BlueChart maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix viewing the BlueChart maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The BlueChart map viewing capability within the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application has been reset sporadically on my Mercury computer. Ultimately, this problem causes difficulty in viewing the current maps, thus necessitating the resetting of the application in question. To date, various actions have been attempted in an effort to correct the issue from within the software suite but invariablynothing seems to work.

Comment

This issue seems to be related to faulty/corrupt map files within the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. In order to remedy this problem, we recommend that you first try reinstalling the entire Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. If this does not resolve the issue, then you may need to restore your computer’s original operating system backup in order to reload the latest maps for use with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enable the real time tracker is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enable the real time tracker is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Every time the real time tracker is reset either by a power outage or manual intervention the guidare boat navigation software suite application is forced to reelection. This causes the software to become unstable and inaccurate.

Comment

We apologize for the inconvenience that this may be causing. It is possible to reset the real time tracker manually by selecting the "RESET" button on the console or by disconnecting power and then reconnecting. We are currently working on a fix that will address the instability issue, but in the meantime please ensure that you reset the timer as soon as it becomes necessary. If you have any other questions or concerns please do not hesitate to contact customer service.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:disable the wind capture function
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: disable the wind capture function is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: disable the wind capture function is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: disable the wind capture function is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

User complaints are coming in asking how to disable the Wind Capture function of the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite which is resetting the application. This Wind Capture function is originally included so sailors could gather data necessary for compass heading during conditions of strong wind or waves. However, many users find it confusing and glitchy to use and say it makes their voyage difficult. What can be done to make disabling the Wind Capture function easy for users?

Comment

Wind capture is a functionality in the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite that collects data necessary for compass heading during conditions of strong wind or waves. However, many users find it confusing and glitchy to use, and say it makes their voyage difficult. To make disabling the Wind Capture function easy for users, we can remove the option completely or provide more detailed instructions on how to use it. We could also create help files or tutorials on our website to walk users through the process. Finally, we could make suggestions along with Compass Settings recommendations to help Sailors avoid entering incorrect data intoWind Capture when sailing in strong winds or waves.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:activating the vessel identification
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: activating the vessel identification is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: activating the vessel identification is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

When launching the Vessel Identification module of the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite the application always prompts "Activating the vessel identification is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Do you want to continue?" regardless of whether or not Vessel Identification activation was successful in the past.

Comment

When a Vessel Identification activation is successful, the application should not prompt for a 'confirmation' because that confirms that Vessel Identification was successfully activated. Minor updates to the Vessel Identification system (e.g. changes to shipping lanes) may result in the software warranting a 'confirmation'. If this happens, the user will be prompted to activate their Vessel Identification and will then be able to continue using the software without interruption.

Length:500

How do i fix: changing the maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: changing the maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The user has discovered that when they change the maps, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application becomes reset and the boat will not move. It appears as if this problem only occurs when the maps are changed while the application is open.

Comment

Hello,

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We have looked into the matter and we can confirm that it is only happening when the applications map is changed while it is open. In order to avoid this happening, we recommend that you make a fresh copy of the maps before opening the application. You can do this by clicking on "File" located in the main menu and then selecting "Make a Copy."

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:mapping a new route
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: mapping a new route is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: mapping a new route is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: mapping a new route is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Mapping a new route is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

One of the issues that users are reporting with their mapping a new route is that the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application stutters, freezes, or recalculates the route more than necessary. Basically, when you map a new route, the software is resetting itself to interpret the coordinates as a new starting point. We're sorry to hear that this is causing trouble for you, and we're working on a resolution. Meanwhile, there are a few options that might work better for you:

· Refresh your navigational database - This restores all of the data in your navigational database to its most recent state. This will usually clear up any errors or glitches that might have occurred since the last time you refreshed your database.

· Choose manually workaround coordinates - In some cases, selecting manually safe coordinates can solve an issue with the software being unable to properly recognize new coordinates. This will require you to enter latitude and longitude values which are not initially represented in digital form by your electronic devices' scanner.

Make sure that you have properly connected your sonar system and try restarting your computer. If the problem persists, please contact Guidare Support for further assistance.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Error code: 114



Dear Customer,

We are sorry to hear that you are struggling to connect to the internal wifi. It sounds like your boat navigation software suite might be resetting due to this issue. Here are some instructions on how to fix this problem:

1) Try re-positioning the boat or antennee if possible. If the issue persists, try one of these troubleshooting steps:
A) Unplug the power cord from the mainboard and plug it back in A couple times; that should reset some values on the motherboard B) Clear all Browser history - Ctrl+ Shift+ Del c) Disconnect and Reconnect the upper WiFi d) Check if cable connections are secure by touching each end with a live wire eye Pick one of these troubleshooting steps and follow its instructions carefully. Please do not continue trying any other steps until you have followed one thoroughly.
Thank you for using our product, and we apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.

Comment

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:viewing the BlueChart maps
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Issues with the BlueChart navigation application resetting when viewing maps have been reported by users. This problem seems to occur randomly, and there is currently no known solution.

When attempting to view a map in the BlueChart navigation application, the application seeminglybehaves as if it has been launched multiple times and each time Zooming in or Panning around causes different layers and graphics within the map window to reset. This results in redo of tasks performed in previous sessions (whether or not local cached data exists), forcing either a reload of the entire application or careful selection of menu commands that avoid triggering the issue. Particularly troublesome are charts with large basemaps loaded, as attempting to move focus away from the chart area repeatedly causes conflicts between loading basemap data while preserving previously zoomed-in orientations, culminating in lost zoom levels and layers as well as shatteredcale graphics.

Comment

In several cases, selecting plotted points or drawing upon map data have also led to fields in a map window resetting to their near-empty defaults.

Although this behavior is intermittent and seems unrelated to other features of the app, it has resulted in variously lost 0.00, survey channel labels; edited item label color/font settings; and incorrect aerial dark green Lambert95 shading across large portions of Kansas, Missouri, Nebraska, and South Dakota. Users encountering such issues are generally unable to locate repair procedures or code paths that could restores functionality. In light of this problem stagnating as an inadequately addressed issue for months and its apparent interaction with charts containing large basemaps or custom markers drawn outside of the natural outline of nodes, we request your help resolving this matter on BlueChart's behalf.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:connecting to sonar
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is resetting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: connecting to sonar is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: connecting to sonar is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to sonar is resetting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Connectorio Sonar counts on being a reliable, high-performance communication hub to support the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suiteapplication. However, intermittently – and seemingly randomly – the software will "reset" itself and require re-connection to Sonar in order to function properly. This usually occurs during periods of heavier network traffic or significant drift in position estimates obtained from GPS or other navigational instruments. The reset can cause incorrect position decode decisions, unexpected routing transfer points and even loss of vessel control.

Comment

Sonar relies on sophisticated networking and processing to provide accurate guidance for the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite – if it's not up to par, that functionality can be impacted. To ensure uninterrupted performance, we need to detectives what may be causing the issues and correct them as quickly as possible. In addition, we should determine how widespread this problem is and how best to address it.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:enable the real time tracker
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the real time tracker is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the real time tracker is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the real time tracker is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

I am running Mercury 13.1 (With the LATPack 1.5 update installed). The "Enable real time tracker" option is not appearing in the Finder when I launch the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. There doesn't seem to be anything on my computer that Symantec can detect as being wrong with the software. If I disable the software and re-enable it, the "Enable real time tracker" option will reappear.

Comment

Hello,

When you launch the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application, you may not see the "Enable real time tracker" option in the Finder. This occurs because the software is using a beta version of the Mercury Louisiana Tracking Service (LATPack) and the "Enable real time tracker" option has not yet been fully integrated into the software. When this beta version of LATPack is no longer available, or when you uninstall the LATPack 1.5 update, the "Enable real time tracker" option will reappear and work as expected. For now, please continue to use LATPack until it has been updated so that this problem does not occur again.



Best,
ac

There is a setting in the Mercury computer's Boot Camp settings which you can disable the guidance software suite. Turning off the guidance software suite should correct the problem and allow you to use the application.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix activating the vessel identification is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix activating the vessel identification is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

In some occasions when a PC is restarted, the modules LGWinActive (Illinois Gateways boat navigation software suite) and Medport (Symantec watermark protection product) may not be loaded as they should when Mercury starts up. Unfortunately, as they are not loaded, Mercury cannot access them to activate the vessel identification icon on the Windows task bar at boot-up. In most cases, rebooting the computer corrects this problem.

Comment

Invalid module WinActive could not be loaded when Mercury starts. This can generally be corrected by rebooting the system; however, in some instances the issue may persist even after a reboot. If there is continuing difficulty activating the vessel identification icon at start-up, please contact Motherboard Support.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix changing the maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix changing the maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The Mercury video navigation system generally operates correctly but occasionally, after booting the software suite (the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application), I can change the virtual maps (profile views) only when the GPS receiver is reconnected. Restarting the entire computer usually corrects this problem.

Comment

Hello,

Thank you for taking the time to reach out. I am sorry to hear that you are experiencing trouble with your Mercury video navigation system. There could be a few potential causes for this issue and my team is eager to investigate and correct it for you as quickly as possible. In the meantime, please try the following troubleshooting tips:

1. Make sure that your device’s battery is fully charged. Battery problems can cause GPS receiver issues and other malfunctions.
2. Make sure that your Mercury video navigation system is properly connected to the internet and your wireless router. Poor connections can interfere with navigation software performance.
3. Review your hardware settings to see if there are any unusual activity or error messages appearing on the device while it is in use. This can indicate a hardware problem that needs to be fixed before jumping into step four. If none of these tips provide resolution, or if you continue having trouble after trying them all, please reach out again and we would be happy to help troubleshoot further.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix enabling the autopilot is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix enabling the autopilot is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, when I try to enable the autopilot, it boots the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. I need to be able to use the autopilot without having to open the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. How can I fix this problem?

Comment

There is no one-size-fits-all solution to this problem, but there are a few things you can do to try and resolve it. First, you may want to consider disabling or avoiding the use of applications that automatically start up when your computer is booting up. Try search for "disable autostart" or "auto start disable" online to find specific instructions for doing this on particular platforms or computers. Additionally, if the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is preventing you from enabling or using the autopilot, you may need to uninstall it or disable certain features in it. You can find more information on how to do this in the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite help file. If these steps do not work, then you may need to contact the software's vendor or manufacturer for support on how to troubleshoot and fix the issue.

On my Mercury, how do I fix enabling the "Fishfinder is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application"? In Firefox, visit about:config and look for the following key: user.cache.fishinggoods
If the value is set to false ( null ), then enable it by changing its value to true . Reboot your computer to apply this change.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:connecting to the internal wifi
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is booting the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix connecting to the internal wifi is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix connecting to the internal wifi is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix connecting to the internal wifi is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Your Mercury is not booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. The problem may be a corrupted boot sequence or failed software installation. Try following the steps below to fix the problem.

Comment

1. Try starting the Mercury in Safe Mode. This can be done by pressing and holding the Shift key while turning the Mercury on. Then, release the Shift key, and press the F8 key to access the boot menu. Select Safe Mode, and continue with the rest of these steps.

2. If Safe Mode does not work, reformat your Mercury drive. To do this, turn off your Mercury, remove the power cord, and drive to a location where you have at least two floppy disks that can be copied onto your Mercury。 Reboot your Mercury by inserting the power cord, selecting the appropriate drive from the boot menu, and clicking OK. When prompted to make a new Bootdisk or Use Diskette Drive, select Copy Diskettes to write onto device. After copying the appropriate disks, reboot your Mercury.

3. Try reinstalling Guide Boat Navigation Software Suite. To do this, open setup.exe and follow the on-screen instructions to complete the installation.

From there, if additional logs provide any information that can help isolate the problem then please post them in your response.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix connecting to sonar is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix connecting to sonar is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

My Mercury is not connecting to the Sonar application even after I have installed the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on it.

Comment

I am sorry to hear that you are having problems connecting your Mercury To The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Make sure that you have downloaded, installed and registered the software correctly. Also make sure that your Mercury is plugged into the same network as your computer and that both devices are on the same edition of Windows. If you still have difficulty getting connected and would like further assistance, please contact us at support@guidare.com

Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: activating the vessel identification is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: activating the vessel identification is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Steps to follow in order to fix the Vessel Identification activation issue:


1. Ensure that the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite software is uninstalled from your computer
2. Reset your Windows PC to its original factory settings
3. Reboot your computer
4. Click on Start and type gpedit.msc in the search bar
5. Access the Group Policy Editor by double clicking on the policy icon under Administrative Tools
6. Under Computer Configuration go to User Rights Assignment
7. Find the User “guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite”, double click on it, and then select Remove
8. Close Group Policy Editor and reboot your computer

Comment

< BR>
If you folow these steps, the Vessel Identification activation issue should now be resolved. If however this still does not resolve the issue, please contact your support team for further assistance.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: mapping a new route is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: mapping a new route is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

This is a problem with the way that the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is initializing. When it boots, it attempts to map a new route, and fails because the old route still exists in memory. This results in an error message that pops up on-screen.

Comment

One potential cause of this problem is if the application was closed very quickly after it started. If so, the application might not have had enough time to finish reloading its map data. Another possibility is that there may be preexisting errors in the map data that are causing this problem. If this is the case, it may be necessary to repair or reformat the map data before using the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite again.

SonarConnectionServer.exe is not starting up when the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is started

This problem usually occurs when there is a problem with the sonar connection. Try to start the sonar connection by clicking on the Start/Run button and entering "sonarserver.exe" in the text box. If this still doesn't work, you can try to start the application manually by clicking on its icon in the system tray and then typing "Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite" in the search field.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enabling the autopilot is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enabling the autopilot is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application becomes enabled even when it is not desired.

Comment

There could be several reasons why the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application might become enabled even when it is not desired. One possible issue is if the user accidently clicks on a menu option that unintentionally activates the application. If this happens, the user may not be aware of what happened until they see the application in use and start experiencing unexpected results.

Another possibility is if the activation criteria for the software are not properly defined or enforced. If the rightful users of the software cannot be confirmed, then any user whose computer reaches a predefined activation condition will also be allowed to use the software. This can lead to unexpected and unintended invocations of the software.

To prevent this from happening, it is important to ensure that all users who should have access to the software have been vetted and identified. In contexts where activated applications must be password-protected, it is also important to create an enforcement mechanism that will prevent unapproved users from attempting to access the software.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

When I try to view the BlueChart maps, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is loading and it takes a really long time to boot.

Comment

Problem:

Whenever you attempt to open the BlueChart Maps application, it takes a long time to load. This is usually because the software suite is loading all of its related files. In some cases, this process can be slowed down if your computer is running slow or burdened with multiple applications running at the same time. Reportedly, America's Cup racing illustrates this scenario as vessels move between lanes. Each boat produces a wake which displaces water and other objects, thus affecting the speed and efficiency of everyone else around them. Similarly, if you have a lot of small file bundles firing off rapid instructions at the same time, your system may struggle to keep up. Although there are no easy answers when it comes to performance, common sense guidelines such as reducing needless processes or consolidating smaller files might make a difference.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: connecting to sonar is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to sonar is booting the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application (GNSS) is not being able to connect to the desired satellites. Examination of the “Properties” tab in the GNSS application confirm that the software is trying to use three different satellites and is giving 301 errors. It would appear that one or more of these satellites are not operational. Please provide a specific description of how you plan to isolate and fix this issue.

Comment

Execute a system guard toIDENTIFY any device drivers that may not be up to date and disable them if necessary. Check for updates for the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite software (eg https://guidare.com/en/support/software-updates). If the source code of the software resides on a remote server, verify that the server security is up to date and hardened against intrusion by reviewing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite SecureSource Guide (https://guidare.com/en/support/guide-securesource). Use specific control procedures in place to avoid possible issues when connecting to mandatory infrastructure provider services such as GPS. These procedures can include verifying information as to whether dynamic IP addresses are assigned, verifying firewall ports are open, checking status of nearby cellular towers, temporarily disabling Anti-Virus software during connections, restricting certain program access rights during periods of active satellite contact etc. Additionally, make use of diagnostic tools specific to boat navigation software suites such as AGNSSAnalysisOfflineExportTool.exe (from https://ps2nav.com/) which can provide some preliminary data on common errors with satellite performance and other useful security alerts. Regularly check boat navigation systems for known assets that may impact GNSS performance, such as large masses or structures within proximity or near horizon line of ship.* Finally investigate all factors which could impact satellite availability and test remedies for each potential issue until success is achieved

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix enable the real time tracker is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, the real time tracker is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. This is causing me trouble as the tracking isn't working correctly and I'm unable to determine my position or course.

Comment

There could be a few possible reasons for this issue. Most likely, there is some incompatibility between the Mercury software and the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. Unfortunately, without knowing more about your specific Mercury software, we can't really help you resolve the issue.

In the case that you are experiencing issues with the real time tracking because of an incompatible application, troubleshooting steps may include verifying that your Mercury software is up-to-date, clearing any browser or whitelisted applicationshops caches and cookies, and; if necessary, reinstalling the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix activating the vessel identification is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

The problem can be corrected by following these steps:

1. Reset the Mercury Vessel Identification system.
2. Exit the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite.
3. Re-enter the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite and activate it.

On my Mercury, how do i fix changing the maps is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix changing the maps is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Your Mercury automobile's map navigation software suite is not accurately providing you with the best path to your destination. In order to fix this problem, you must first identify the cause of the incorrect navigation. Once you have determined the reason for the erroneous guidance, you will need to correct the issue.

Comment

Fortunately, there are a few steps you can take to correct this issue:

1. Check the batteries in your Mercury's map navigation software suite. If the batteries are low, their power might be draining the electronic compass ordetector unit, which canresultinpoor direction finding. Replace the depletedbatteries with fresh ones.

2.Make sure that your Mercury is correctly oriented while driving routes on the map - ensure that buildings, signs and other landmarks appear in the correct orientation. If you have doubts about your location, pull over and enter your destination into the Mercury's nav_key device (found below the shift lever) to confirm that directions are beingprovided more accuratley.

3.Download and install updated map information for your region. Sometimes an update to highway data will help improve the accuracy of mapping software on Mercury road vehicles. Be sure to check for software updatesVerDateJun<-> Date> 2020 at SYNAGIS websites or [ authorized merck dealer ]. Carefullyreview all routing information beforedriving away from a mercedes dealership asbenjamin sasha manyvehicles come equipped with after-sale support services thatmayinclude suchupdates!

4.Ensure that all vehicle functions - such as acceleration and braking - have been properly turned off when using the mapnavigation system; vibrations causedby active system functions cangive inaccurate directional feedback. holding down successivelane changing buttons whileovan pro russia 67 murray 13 diagnostic examination m30 lenses startinggives plenty 07 onsdviagraforsale


To solve this problem, try one or more of these solutions:
activating new battery pack , ensuringdrive activatedsystem Function is turned off ],checking orientation of approaching landmarks ,verifying downloadable Map Updates .

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix mapping a new route is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix mapping a new route is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

This occurs due to discrepancies between your GPS receiver's latitude/longitude coordinate system and the Mercury's astrological coordinate system. MeridianGPS can fix the coordinates for you, but requires that you have recent map data to work with. There are also various utility programs available which can transfer data into zones ~/.mercuryshellrc . Here is an example shellrc file:



subsystem maps path "/usr/local/lib64/meridiangps-2.1.0/_scripts/" function zoneMap() { squirrel_ramdisk -c "echo -e \"

#!/bin/bash

ln -s `pwd`/$1 ${ZONES}

\"" 1>&2 } # use this to enable zone map startup script
zones = "${HOME}/.mercuryshellrc" # explicitly specify user's home directory extent echo "#include '${zones}'" >>${zones} pills = "ROOTPATH=/usr/local\/tmp\/MercuryPillars\\_SingleTrip;;' ROOTPATH=/usr/share\/multimarinetcore;;' PHONEBOOK=${PHONEBOOK:-1}" echo $? >>$?

Comment

Alternatively, you may need to install a new boat navigation software suite on Mercury if you want to use that type of software.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:enabling the autopilot
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:On my [BOAT], how do i fix [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: On my Mercury, how do i fix enabling the autopilot is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix enabling the autopilot is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix enabling the autopilot is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

In order to get the Mercury to autopilot correctly, you will need to reset the guidance boat navigation software suite. This will erase all of your current information and configure the Mercury for autopilot use. Here are a few steps that you can take in order to do this:


1) Rotate theMercury power off and on again- During startup the guidance boat navigation software suite should try to load automatically- if it doesn't then manually start it by pressing «GPS». After turning the power off and on again, resetting the software should force it to load.


2) Resetting access permissions- In order for the guidance boat navigation software suite torun properly, you may need to reset the permissions on certain files. Holding down both «Ctrl» keys when opening «\\ path- ComputerName » will open up Security Wizard (depending upon your OS version).Tab »Privacy» under General Options

and deselecting everything except «WriteEveryone» ensure that no other programs have permissions write access to these files. CAUTION: Resetting Visibility might result in lostor altered data, backup copies are advisable prior to making changes. Reverting these changes afterwards is rarely necessary unless done accidentally.

Comment

Alternatively disable emergency erasure if required (usually user turn-off prevents accidental erasures).

IMPORTANT NOTE:: All data in the Mercury's GPS Data Ports is automatically backed up during every ECMD operation. Reverting these changes afterwards is rarely necessary unless done accidentally. Alternatively disable emergency erasure if required (usually user turn-off prevents accidental erasures).

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix enabling the fishfinder is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix enabling the fishfinder is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Hello!
I am experiencing an error when trying to enable the Fishfinder in my Mercury, both on command and through the software suite. Every time I try to open it, I get a message saying 'Enabled Fishfinder Failed'.
Can you help me fix this issue?

Comment

Hello!

We are sorry to hear that you are experiencing an error when trying to enable the Fishfinder in your Mercury. Unfortunately, we can't seem to help you fix this issue. If you're able, please reach out to your vehicle representative for more guidance. Thanks for using our product!

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix connecting to the internal wifi is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix connecting to the internal wifi is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

On my Mercury, how do i fix connecting to the internal wifi is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

This problem can be resolved by following these instructions:


Press the "Research" button on the Mercury's touchscreen.
Tap on "WiFi."
Select your network and enter the password.
Select "Stay Connected."
Tap on the three-stripe icon in the top left corner of the screen to connect to wireless Internet. If you still experience issues, please follow these steps:


Step 1: From your mercuryÎs home screen, tap â€œ Mercury Companion Store. Step 2: Tap on ™Settings (3 bar) 2. In â€œWiFi Setup,â€§ tap on 3 Authentication Type then make sure AP Settings are pointed to Manual Local Network Even if your wifi is connected . You may also disconnect Mercury from your modem/router for a few minutes and reconnect it, following Steps 3 though Step 5 below.
If you experience any more difficulties locating this wireless network or resolving connectivity issues please call Customer Service at 1-800- administrated number.

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix viewing the BlueChart maps is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

My Mercury is displaying the BlueChart maps application with an error. I tried rebooting my Mercury and also uninstalling and reinstall the BlueChart software suite, but the problem persists. Can you provide guidance on how to fix this issue?

Comment

There could be a number of reasons behind the Mercury displaying an error when trying to open the BlueChart maps application. Some common causes might be the Mercury is missing certain required software, there is an issue with your computer system, or you might need to adjust your settings in regards to how the software runs. In most instances, restoring your Mercury backup or repairing it can fix the problem.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix connecting to sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix connecting to sonar is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The application crashes after connecting to vessel's sonar* and the Navigation Suite graphics performance is significantly affected.



1. Check if your computer has the latest drivers for your hardware and software: Windows Update, manufacturer's website. Take into account that updating your drivers may also affect other functions of your computer.

2. Verify that the application is properly installed: from the Start menu, search for Mercury/graphic software suite and open it. If you uninstalled or lost the application, you can re-download it from our website or from the Windows Store .
7. Make sure that your computer's speakers are working properly: verify that their volume is set to a reasonable level and make sure the microphone is not blocked by hardware or software (printers, scanners, etc.). 8. Disable any Antivirus or Firewall software that is interfering with installation or using the computer normally: by closing programs required for interacting with our servers (such as MSN messenger, malwarebytes Controlpanel content Microsoft OneDrive ) In some cases, this can interfere with normal video or internet communication without first warning the customer About this issue Resolution
1. Restart your computer: holding down Shift on startup when windows starts should disable running certain applications Background tasks provided by Windows (game consoles, air conditioners ,etc.) Now try starting Mercury Graphic Software Suite From the Start Menu Or Since MRG SSOUE Keep Crashing I'v Tried Reinstalling It 3 Times I even Used A Different Passport Out Of CUSTOMER Frustration What Can I Do?


A user's computer crashes shortly after attempting to open Mercury Graphic Software Suite -- this version of the software suite provides navigation services for boats utilizing sonar technology. Updated drivers were not found to be responsible for the crash; however, an unsuccessful attempt was made to reinstall Mercury Graphic software suite three times in less than a year and one customer had unsuccessfully used a different passport in an effort to resolve customer frustration.

Comment

Resolution? 1. Try restarting their computer and see if that resolved the issue. 2. If they cannot restart their computer, they should consider trying to download Mercury Graphic Software Suite from our website or from the Windows Store . Disabling any antivirus or firewall software that may be interfering with the installation or using of the software should also be attempted.

Length:500

How do i fix: disable the wind capture function is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: disable the wind capture function is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

Disabling the wind capture function is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Comment

There could be several reasons why disabling the wind capture function is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. It is possible that disabling the wind capture function garbled any previous correct usage of wind data into incorrect information. Alternatively, disabling the wind capture function may have caused another problem in relation to weather or water conditions that negatively impacted accuracy or usefulness of the guidance and tracking features of the vessel's software suite. In either scenario, resolving the underlying issue(s) will likely restore full functionality to the application.

Problem

How do i fix: activating the vessel identification is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

activating the vessel identification is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application. When you launch the software, you may be prompted to activate the vessel identification. However, when you try to activate the vessel identification, it errors out. This error prevents the software from launching. The problem could be caused by a missing or corrupted activation file. To fix this issue, you'll need to restore your activation file from backup or re-renty your software.

Comment

There may be a problem activating the vessel identification. This error prevents the software from launching, most likely due to a missing or corrupted activation file. To fix this issue, you will need to restore your activation file from backup or re-rent your software.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: mapping a new route is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: mapping a new route is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

When mapping a new route, the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is erroring.

Comment

There could be a few things causing the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application error when mapping a new route. One possibility is that you do not have the correct permissions to view or edit routes. Another possibility is that there are too many intersecting routes between two points on the map. Lastly, it is possible thatyou do not have valid location data for one of the points on the route. If you are experiencing difficulty with mapping a new route, it might help to try using a different tool or babying the map's boundaries slightly in order to create cleaner and clearer lines.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: enabling the fishfinder is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The fishfinder is erroring the submarine navigation suite application. This problem can be fixed by following these steps:
- Disconnect the power supply to the fishfinder
- Restore the systempoint backups
- Verify the mount point settings on the Fishfinder
- Disable service feedback on S sonar unit


1. Remove power to t he fish find er;
2 . Sync system point backups;
3. Check mount point settings on t he Fishfinder;
4. Disable mission feedback from sonar unit

Comment

.


There are various factors that can cause an error with fishfinder mount points such as disrupted signal paths or incorrect data. Disconnecting the power supply and restoring system point backups can help fix certain errors, but others may still persist. Ultimately, it may be necessary to reconfigure the mount points on the fishfinder in order to correct the underlying issue.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: connecting to the internal wifi is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

The Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application is working properly when connected to the internal wifi, but is erroring when attempting to connect to anywdere else.

Comment

There could be a number of reasons the software is failing to connect, including firewall settings, internet service provider (ISP) type, and router capabilities. Check your connection settings and make sure the software is able to pick up an open network Connection. If you are using a public library or coffee shop with open wifi, try reconnecting to that network first before trying to connect anywhere else. If all fails, consult with your IT staff about possible solutions.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:viewing the BlueChart maps
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:How do i fix: [KEYWORD] is erroring the [PRODUCT] application.
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

How do i fix: viewing the BlueChart maps is erroring the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

When trying to view the BlueChart maps from within the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application, it is reporting an error.

Comment

The error that BlueChart maps is reporting is likely due to an incorrect configuration of the software on your device. To try and fix this issue, you will need to follow these steps:

1. Close all open applications on your device. This includes the Guidare Boat Navigation Suite application as well as any other Map or GPS app.

2. Launch the Guidare Boat Navigation Suite app from your home screen. Ensure that you are using the most recent version of the app.

3. Once the app has opened, select the "Settings" menu option located in the bottom right hand corner of the screen.

4. On the "Settings" page, scroll down to the "Maps" heading and click on the "Manage Maps" button located below it.

5. From the "Maps" page, select either "View Current Maps" or "Add Map". Whichever method you select will allow you to add a new map into your navigation suite application.

6. Click on the blue "Search Maps" button located directly below the selected map type (in my case I clicked on the blue "City Navigator US 24x7" map). This will bring up a search bar which you can use to locate and select the BlueChart map that you would like to use in your navigation.

Symptoms

Comment

To troubleshoot your network connection, please follow our Troubleshooting Guide. Additionally, if you're experiencing an error loading projects from a server, try uploading them to a local disk first. If you still experience issues, please check our troubleshooting documents for more help.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:there is no connection to the sensors
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:I need a fix for [KEYWORD] on my [PRODUCT].
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: I need a fix for there is no connection to the sensors on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for there is no connection to the sensors on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for there is no connection to the sensors on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

I have a Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite and there is no connection to the sensors. I have tried plugging everything in and reinstalling the software, but nothing seems to work.

Comment

The issue could be with the electronics itself or a crimp in the wire. It could also be the need for higher download speeds for certain remote programming functions by Guidare – this will depend on what equipment you are using to access the remote programming. Additionally, if a power cycling/reinstallation of Guidare is not immediately correcting the issue, it might be worth checking there is nothing obstructing wireless signal receptivity to the boat’s receivers (e.g. trees, branches, buildings).

I need a fix for cannot connect to Panoptix device on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for cannot connect to Panoptix device on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

I'm having problems connecting to my Panoptix device on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. When I try to connect, I get the following message: "An error occurred while trying to connect to the server. Please contact technical support for more information."

Comment

There could be a few reasons why this is happening. First, your computer could be down or something could be wrong with the way you're connecting to the Panoptix device. You might also want to check to make sure that your Panoptix device is turned on and connected to your computer. If everything else seems to be working fine, you can try updating your Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

I need a fix for cannot connect other devices on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

I need a fix for cannot connect other devices on my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

Symptoms

I am having trouble connecting other devices to my Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. For example, I connect my iPhone to the software and attempt to use features on the app, but I get a message that says ERROR – Cannot Connect to Server. This happens even when I am close to the computer that the software is installed on.

Comment

There could be a few reasons why you are having difficulty connecting your devices to the Guidare Boat Navigation software suite. One possibility is that you are not adequately plugging in your devices. Check to see if all of your devices are properly plugged into the computer and network ports, and reconfigure any necessary settings on your devices. Another possibility is that your device and/or the software are not compatible. Verify that your device is using the latest manufacturer drivers and software, and check for any updates available for the software. If all of these solutions fail to resolve the problem, please submit a ticket to our support team so we can further investigate.

There are several possible remedies for this:A) Verify that your ports are open and receptive to wifi signal.B) Reset your modem/router.C) Ensure that the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite is installed and up-to-date on your computer.D) Try following these steps:1) Right-click on the "icon" on your desktop or Start screen, and select "Create Shortcut".2) Double-click on the shortcut you just created, and specify the "/online" as the target.3) Try connecting to the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite using this address: https://www.gidaramarine.com/en

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:there is a blinking red led
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:When using the product [PRODUCT] on my [BOAT], [KEYWORD].
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, there is a blinking red led.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, there is a blinking red led.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, there is a blinking red led.

Symptoms

One of the blue status lights on controller board of a Mercury Sable Hockey automobile recommends using Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite when driving. This software suite provides real-time marine tracking and route guidance. However, if the blue Status light is blinking red while using this software, it means there is a problem with the initialize button in the back of the unit. Attempting to touch or hit this button while the software is running may cause damage to the unit or even loss of function.

Comment

There are three options for repairing a Mercury Sable Hockey automobile if the blue status light is blinking red while using the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite:
1) Remove the software suite and attempt an initialize of the unit. If this does not work, replace the control board.
2) If the software suite is still operational, disconnect the power source to the unit and re-connect it. The software should start up in this condition.
3) If Operation #2 is not successful, then remove the controller board entirely and replace it.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:the progress bar keeps spinning
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:When using the product [PRODUCT] on my [BOAT], [KEYWORD].
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the progress bar keeps spinning.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the progress bar keeps spinning.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the progress bar keeps spinning.

Symptoms

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the progress bar keeps spinning.

Comment

There are a few potential causes for this issue. Diagnosing and fixing the problem will depend on its severity.
Listed below are some of the more common causes and potential fixes:

- Update your software: Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite updates are available every month to improve stability and performance. If you have not updated in a while, do so now. If the issue persists after updating, try the following steps: Unplug your MercurySync cable from your computer. Remove any obstacles between your Mercury and the computer that is running Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. Click the "Programs and Features" tab on the Windows Start Menu, select Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, right-click it, and select "Options." Change your installation type toamd64 (64-bit). Close all open windows and restart your MercurySync. Try using Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite again.
- Disable flash animations: Flash animations can sometimes cause problems with loading graphics or running programs. To disable flash animations on your Mercury, go to Settings > System > User Profile > System Setting (gear icon at top left of main screen),tap Advanced Power Settings, tap Use Hidden Menu Or Screen, enable choose Customize power settings for用户 , change Active display setting to "Disable Colored blending of windows" .Restart your Mercury afterward.
- Verify your web connection: Make sure the web connection between your computer and Mercury is strong and up-to-date. Sometimes weak connections can cause issues with online services like Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Keyword:the map is not being displayed
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Title Sentence:When using the product [PRODUCT] on my [BOAT], [KEYWORD].
Problem Sentence:Create a description for this problem: [TITLE] for the product [PRODUCT].
Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the map is not being displayed.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the map is not being displayed.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, the map is not being displayed.

Symptoms

The software receives user input of latitude and longitude through handheld inputs or through an optional portable device. The accompanying on-screen map shall, however, display positions received from both the hand-held and portable inputs simultaneously. Upon launch, the MSL and Course data files may be initialized but upon later launch, the map will not be displayed. Examination of the debug log shows that each time the interactive debugging tool pops up, cached nav fix status is updated which causes the map to immediately start rendering but zoom level & bar metrics do not get calculated until a moment after that, which prevents placement of waypoints/markers. This issue is documented in HWrt1538.

Comment

There are two possible solutions for this problem: prevent the cached nav fix status from being updated when the debug log pops up, or recalculate the zoom level and bar metrics after debugging is closed.

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, there is no connection to the sensors.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, there is no connection to the sensors.

Symptoms

When applying the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite to a Mercury, users may experience a lack of sensor connection. Testing suggests that this issue is caused by a possible issue with Mercury's radio but is unrelated to the installation of the Guidare software suite itself.

Comment

A possible issue with Mercury's radio is causing the a lack of sensor connection, but this is unrelated to the installation of the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite itself. To address this issue, users should check that their Mercury's radio is operable and capable of connecting to the Guidare software suite's sensors. If not, they should install a new radio or wait until an updated version of the software suite is released.

createCase

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite

Symptoms Sentence:Create a detailed problem description for: When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, cannot connect to built in wifi.
Temp:1.2
Length:500

createCaseComment

Product:Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite
Boat:Mercury
Version:1
Temp:1.2
Length:500

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, cannot connect to built in wifi.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

When using the product Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury, cannot connect to built in wifi.

Symptoms

I'm using the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite on my Mercury and continuously have trouble connecting to the built in wifi. Whether I'm at home or on a boat, the software will not connect to the wifi. Every time I try to connect, it prompts me to " enter network key ". However, I never receive a notification when I've entered the network key or followed any instructions. I've tried resetting my network settings, uninstalling and reinstalling the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite, and even upgrading my computer's operating system. Nothing has worked. Does anyone have any suggestions?

Comment

There could be a number of reasons why you are having difficulty connecting to the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. One possibility is that your device's network security settings are preventing the software from connecting. To check this, attempt to connect to the software using any other device on your home or workplace network and see if the connection is successful. If not, please check the guidance provided in our troubleshooting document for specific steps on how to configure your network security settings.

If your computer can access the internet and the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite can connect to the web-based user interface, it possible that one of your internet security measures is interfering with the communication between your computer and the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite. To test this, open a web browser on another computer on your home or workplace network and navigate to our website. If you are experiencing problems connecting to our website, please review our internet security guidelines and take necessary steps to adjust your security settings. Finally, if you have upgraded your computer's operating system, there is a possibility that you have installed incompatibilities and updated applications that could also be causing connectivity problems. In order to resolve these issues, it may require some intervention from an experienced technician.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the wind capture function is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix disable the wind capture function is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

In attempting to tackle some disk space issues on our computer, we disabled the wind capture function in an effort to save disc space. However, this has caused problems with the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application, which is now shutting down automatically. We need to resolve this problem before our navigation system becomes unusable.

Comment

One potential solution to this problem would be to consider restoring the wind capture function to its previous state. This may solve some of the underlying disk space issues and allow the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application to operate normally. Additionally, it may be helpful to monitor disk space usage and make note of any unexpected changes so that appropriate action can be taken should space become an issue again.

Temp:1.2
Length:500

On my Mercury, how do i fix activating the vessel identification is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

For model: Mercury

Installed version: 1

Problem

On my Mercury, how do i fix activating the vessel identification is shutting down the Guidare Boat Navigation Software Suite application.

Symptoms

This occurs when the Mercury switch that controls activation of the vessel identification system (V.I.S.) is switched off or disconnected. If this switch is not repaired or replaced, then the V.I.S. cannot be activated and the Guidare boat navigation software suite application will quit working.

Comment

A Mercury switch controls activation of the Vessel Identification System on most vessels. If it is switched off or disconnected, then the V.I.S. will not work and the Guidare boat navigation software suite application will quit working.

Mega, 7z, Winzip document extractors may corrupt the file. Try unzipping with a different program like WinRAR or 7-ZIP. GOBOAT sometimes helps recognizing corrupt files automatically when saved in Photoshop/GIMP files.
